Fry up on med heat. Add garlic, cook til garlic soft.
Add sauce, saute a bit. Add water a little and let boil.
Add green onions, saute. Add perilla powder + sesame seeds at end.
Universal namul recipe!:
For ~300g dried namul, 1 tbsp oil, 1 minced garlic, 2 tbsp sesame oil, 2 tbsp soy sauce, green onion.

name: gosari namul
directions: Í≥†ÏÇ¨Î¶¨ÎÇòÎ¨º
In medium pot, gosari and 4-5 cup water. Boil covered over med heat til tender (~30-40min). Turn heat off and let cool in cooking water. Rinse in cold water and drain.
Cut into 3-4" pieces. Remove tough stem ends if needed.
Mix gosari with soy sauce, sugar, garlic. Let sit 10 min.
Saute in skillet with 1 tbsp oil for 4-5 min med heat. Pour in water/broth, cook for few more min stirring occasionally til water mostly gone.
Add rest of ingredients. Stir well. Take off heat.

name: spinach namul

items.name: soup soy sauce
items.note: or 2 tsp gochujang + 2 tsp soy sauce

directions: ÏãúÍ∏àÏπòÎÇòÎ¨º
Rinse spinach. Blanch in salted boiling water til wilted (20-30sec). Quickly remove and shock in icy cold water.
Drain and squeeze excess water gently. Cut into 3" length
Toss and mix well with rest of ingredients.
Store 3-4 days in fridge.

name: peanut jorim
directions: ÎïÖÏΩ©Ï°∞Î¶º
Bring peanuts + 2 cup water to a boil. Boil for 5 min. Drain.
Return peanuts to pot. Add soy sauce, mirin, sugar, corn syrup, water/broth.
Bring to boil. Reduce meat to med and gently boil uncovered til most sauce evaporated (~20-25min).
Stir occasionally but monitor to prevent burning. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Keep in fridge up to 2-3 weeks.

name: potato jorim
directions: (1) Potatoes + carrots. (2) Sauce. (3) Onion. (4) Peppers.
Í∞êÏûêÏ°∞Î¶º
Cut potatoes into 1" cubes. Cut other veg into big chunks.
Mix all braising ingredients except sesame seeds, stir well
In non-stick pan/pot, saute potatoes + carrots over med heat 4-5 min, stir occasionally.
Add sauce and bring to boil over high heat. Add onion.
Cover, reduce heat to med, cook till potatoes almost cooked thru (~5 min), firm but not mushy.
Stir in peppers. Boil uncovered til sauce reduced and thick (~3min). Garnish with sesame seeds.
Keeps in fridge 2-3 days.

name: parsnip jorim
directions: Batonnet parsnips into ~1.5" long batons.
Pound the parsnip flat (being careful not to break them apart)
Fry on nonstick pan with sesame oil med heat til pieces start to brown. Use a bit of water to braise until parsnips are soft.
Pour in sauce and cook for a few more min on low heat.

name: eomuk bokkeum
directions: (1) Sliced veg. (2) Fish cake. (3) Sauce.
Ïñ¥Î¨µ Î≥∂Ïùå
Thinly slice veg. Combine and mix all sauce ingredients well.
Non stick pan on med high heat, cook veg for 1-2 min or til silghtly soft.
Reduce heat to med, cook fish cake ~2 min. Stir in sauce well, cook ~2 min.
Veg options are to liking--can do green onions, chili peppers, etc
Keep 4-5 days in fridge.

name: steamed shishito
directions: ÍΩàÎ¶¨Í≥†Ï∂îÏ∞ú
Trim, rinse, and drain peppers. Toss peppers in flour to coat.
Bring water in steamer to "high simmer." Add peppers, cover, and steam for ~5 min or til tender. Don't overcook or will get mushy!
Toss peppers in sauce.
Keeps for few days in fridge.

name: myulchi bokkeum
directions: Î©∏Ïπò
Cook anchovies 2-3 min over med heat in pan with oil. Turn off heat. Set anchovies aside on plate.
Mix well all sauce ingredients except sesame oil and seeds. Pour into pan you were using, and boil over med heat til bubbly and silghtly thick (~2-3min).
Add anchovies back in and optional jalapeno. Stir well til anchovies coated well. Garnish with sesame oil and sesame seeds.
Keeps in fridge up to a week.

name: shiitake bokkeum

items.name: dried shiitake mushroom
items.note: soaked 2hr-overnight in hot water. sliced 0.3cm thick

directions: ÌëúÍ≥†Î≤ÑÏÑØ Î≥∂Ïùå
(1) Oil, garlic. (2) Onion. (3) Mushroom, sauce. (4) Green onion, sesame seed, sesame oil.
Toss sliced and drained mushrooms in salt.
On med heat non stick pan, fry garlic in oil til golden brown. Add onion and fry 2 more min til transparent.
Add mushroom, sauce, and stir fry 5 more min.
Once mushrooms are cooked, add garnish and serve.

name: banchan week
directions: Makes 4 lunches of rice + banchan and 1 dinner bibimbap.
Universal namul recipe:
Soak stems til soft (6hrs-overnight). Cut into bite size length, strain.
Fry up on med heat. Add garlic, cook til garlic soft.
Add sauce, saute a bit. Add water a little and let boil.
Add green onions, saute. Add sesame seeds at end.
Eomuk Bokkeum (Ïñ¥Î¨µ Î≥∂Ïùå):
(1) Sliced veg. (2) Fish cake. (3) Sauce.
Thinly slice veg. Combine and mix all sauce ingredients well.
Non stick pan on med high heat, cook veg for 1-2 min or til silghtly soft.
Reduce heat to med, cook fish cake ~2 min. Stir in sauce well, cook ~2 min.
Potato Jorim (Í∞êÏûêÏ°∞Î¶º):
(1) Potatoes + carrots. (2) Sauce. (3) Onion. (4) Peppers.
Cut potatoes into 1" cubes. Cut other veg into big chunks.
Mix all braising ingredients except sesame seeds, stir well
In non-stick pan/pot, saute potatoes + carrots over med heat 4-5 min, stir occasionally.
Add sauce and bring to boil over high heat. Add onion.
Cover, reduce heat to med, cook till potatoes almost cooked thru (~5 min), firm but not mushy.
Stir in peppers. Boil uncovered til sauce reduced and thick (~3min). Garnish with sesame seeds.

name: banchan week 2

items.name: soup soy sauce
items.note: or 2 tsp gochujang + 2 tsp soy sauce

directions: Makes 3 lunches of rice + banchan and 1 dinner bibimbap.
Prep:
Mince the 5 garlic cloves, and set aside into 3 piles (one pile per banchan).
Start boiling spinach water and prepare ice bath for spinach.
Start thinly slicing veg for eomuk while other person works on spinach.
Finish spinach first, then move onto eomuk. Use same frying pan later for parsnip.
Spinach Namul (ÏãúÍ∏àÏπòÎÇòÎ¨º):
Rinse spinach. Blanch in salted boiling water til wilted (20-30sec). Quickly remove and shock in icy cold water.
Drain and squeeze excess water gently. Cut into 3" length
Toss and mix well with rest of ingredients.
Eomuk Bokkeum (Ïñ¥Î¨µ Î≥∂Ïùå):
(1) Sliced veg. (2) Fish cake. (3) Sauce.
Thinly slice veg. Combine and mix all sauce ingredients well.
Non stick pan on med high heat, cook veg for 1-2 min or til silghtly soft.
Reduce heat to med, cook fish cake ~2 min. Stir in sauce well, cook ~2 min.
Parsnip Jorim:
Batonnet parsnips into ~1.5" long batons.
Pound the parsnip flat (being careful not to break them apart)
Fry on nonstick pan with sesame oil med heat til pieces start to brown. Use a bit of water to braise until parsnips are soft.
Pour in sauce and cook for a few more min on low heat.

name: kung pao
directions: Marinate, cook high heat, and set aside protein.
1 tsp oil into wok med heat, cook scallions, ginger, and garlic with the peppercorn powder on low. Cook for 1-2 min.
Add protein back in. Turn heat up and stir fry with the sauce for 1 min. Add peanuts, stir quick, and serve.

name: cashew tofu stirfry

items.name: green onion
items.note: divide into white and green parts

directions: (1) Oil, green onion white parts, garlic, carrot. (2) Baked tofu, sauce. (3) Bell pepper, cashew, sesame oil, green onion garnish.
Toss pressed and cubed tofu with soy sauce and oil. Sprinkle cornstarch and toss again. Spread onto baking pan, no pieces touching, and bake at 425F for 30 min, flipping pieces halfway.
In nonstick pan or wok med heat, cook green onion white parts, garlic, and carrot for 1 min or til carrot a bit soft.
Add in the baked tofu, pour sauce over, stir well. Bring to simmer and cook 3-5 min or til thickened.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in bell pepper, cashew, sesame oil, garnish.
Leftovers store in fridge for 5 days.
To steam broccoli:
Steam on high heat for 4 min or til vibrant green.

name: sesame shiitake stirfry
directions: (1) Oil, coated mushrooms. (2) Sauce. (3) Garnish.
Cover mushrooms in boiling water. Soak for 40 min or til tender. Drain and squeeze/shake water off gently. Slice into 1/2" thick slices.
Toss mushrooms in cornstarch til evenly coated. Shake off excess.
Heat oil in skillet med-high heat til hot. Fry mushrooms til lightly golden on all sides and no cornstarch remains.
Mix sauce ingredients and cook in medium pot for 2 min or thickened.
Add in fried shiitake and toss to coat. Garnish and serve.

name: chili oil
directions: Keep at 225-250F for 30 min. Pour over gochugaru.
Makes 1.5 cups of oil? Store in fridge for 6 months.
Makes 393g of oil (7-8g per tbsp. ~50 tbsp total)

name: 2 day spam congee
directions: Rinse rice and drain.
Bring water to a boil, then add rice. Bring back to a boil and simmer on med heat for 1 hr til thick.
Soft boil eggs. (Place in boiling water for 7-8ish min).
Put eggs in sauce, try to get all covered. Soak overnight. Eat within 5 days.

name: 2 day tuna congee
directions: Rinse rice and drain.
Bring water to a boil, then add rice. Bring back to a boil and simmer on med heat for 1 hr til thick.
Soft boil eggs. (Place in boiling water for 7-8ish min).

name: dan bing
directions: Makes 3 pancakes
Mix flour, salt, water with spatula until sticky dough forms, ~2-3 min.
Coat dough with 3/4 tsp veg oil. Cover with plastic wrap. Rest for 1 hr.
Roll out with rolling pin into almost translucent.
Heat skillet or frying pan over med high heat.
Add 1/2 tsp oil. Lift rolled out dough, place evenly in pan.
Crack 1 egg into center of dough. Lightly spread egg around over top of dough.
Drizzle another 1/2 tsp oil on top.
Flip and cook this for 10 sec.
Flip again. Let cook for another min or until golden brown.
Roll each pancake up, slice the rolls, and top with sauce.

name: mapo tofu
directions: (1) Peppercorn, ginger, garlic. (2) Pork. (3) The beans. (4) Cornstarch. (5) Chili oil. (6) Tofu.
Heat oil on wok, med heat.
Add ground peppercorns and stir occasionally for 30 sec. Add ginger. After 1 min, add garlic.
After 1 min, turn heat to high and add ground pork. Fry til cooked thru.
Add spicy bean sauce, stir in well. Add beans and cook for 30 sec.
Add 2/3 c water and stir. Simmer for 1 min.
Mix cornstarch with 1/4 c water. Add mix to sauce and stir.
Add chili oil, stir, and add tofu. Cook for 3-5 min.

name: mapo rice cakes
directions: (1) Peppercorn, ginger, garlic. (2) Pork. (3) The beans. (4) Rice cakes. (5) Tofu, green onion.
Heat oil on wok, med heat. Add aromatics. Cook for 2 min.
After 2 min, turn heat to high and add ground pork. Fry til cooked thru.
Add spicy bean sauce, stir in well. Add beans and cook for 30 sec.
Turn heat down to med. Add rice cakes, stir and cook til soft. While cooking, use up to 1/4c water to deglaze as needed.
Add tofu and cook and gently stir til all combined. Garnish with sliced green onion.

name: chicken black bean stirfry
directions: Marinate chicken.
2 tbsp oil on med heat. Cook beans, garlic, chicken til chicken is opaque.
Add veg and stir fry for 1 min.
Add sugar, ginger powder, wine, salt. Stir fry.

name: cumin lamb

items.name: oil
items.note: optional if lamb is a fattier cut

directions: Cut lamb. Marinate for 30min.
Dry toast cumin seeds on med heat. Set aside.
High heat wok. Once hot, 2 tbsp oil and lamb.
Sear meat until crispy and brown.
Add rest of ingredients and toss til just combined (greens will be wilted). Serve.

name: eggplant with garlic sauce
directions: (1) Eggplants. (2) Pork. (3) Ginger, garlic. (4) Sauce.
Cut eggplants. Soak fully submerged in salt water for 15 min. Drain and pat dry.
Coat eggplants in cornstarch by hand.
1 tbsp oil in nonstick skillet med high heat. Spread eggplants without overlap. (if at any point, too smokey, turn to med heat)
Cook eggplants one side at a time til charred and soft (~8-10min total). Transfer eggplants to plate.
Remaining oil, cook pork for til MOSTLY not pink. Add garlic and ginger and cook til soft.
Add all eggplants back, pour sauce over, quickly stir a few times til all coated and sauce is thick.

name: tomato egg
directions: (1) Whisked egg, salt, pepper, sesame oil, shaoxing. (2) Cut tomatoes, chopped scallions. (3) Sugar, salt, water.
Wok on med high heat (7/10) til just smoking.
2 tbsp oil and immediately add egg. Scramble and immediately remove. Set aside.
1 tbsp oil, wok to high heat (8/10), add tomatoes and scallions. Stir fry for a min.
Add sugar, salt, water. Add cooked eggs. Mix everything, cover and cook 1-2 min til tomatoes soft.
Uncover. Stir fry til sauce is thickened/water is reduced to liking.

name: mongolian beef
directions: (1) Marinated beef. (2) Ginger, garlic, chili pepper. (3) Hot water, soy sauce, sugar. (4) Cornstarch slurry. (5) Green onion.
Marinate beef for 1hr in oil, soy sauce, cornstarch, water.
Lightly coat beef in cornstarch.
Wok high heat. Spread half the beef evenly in wok, sear beef for 1 min, then 30 sec on other side. Set to side, try to let oil drain. Cook the other half.
Drain oil from wok, leave 1 tbsp behind. Turn heat to med-high. Add ginger and dried peppers, if using, and garlic after 15 sec.
After 10 sec, add water, soy sauce, sugar
Bring sauce to a simmer, let simmer for ~2min and slowly stir in cornstarch slurry until the sauce coats back of spoon.

Add beef and green onions. Toss everything together for 30 sec. Should be almost no liquid, sauce should be clinging to the beef. If you still have sauce, increase the heat slightly and stir until thickened.

name: gai lan with oyster sauce
directions: Clean gai lan well. If any stems are very thick, cut lengthwise to make thinner.
Put 8 cup already boiling water, olive oil, and salt in pot on high heat.
Wait for water to boil again. Once boiling, add gai lan (should be submerged!), cover.
Let water come back to boil. Once boiling again, flip gai lan, then cook 1-2 more min covered.
If you want softer, can add another 1-3 min of cooking.
Transfer gai lan to plate, make 1-2 cuts along stems, drizzle with oyster sauce and more olive oil to taste.

name: pork belly cabbage dry stirfry

items.name: gochugaru
items.note: to sub 5 roughly chopped dried chili peppers

items.name: balsamic vinegar
items.note: optional; to sub chinese black vinegar

directions: (1) Oil, meat. (2) Garlic, ginger, chilies, green onion. (3) Cabbage, wine, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, water. (4) Vinegar.
Chop cabbage into bite size pieces. Wash and THOROUGHLY dry.
Wok on high heat. Add oil. Sear meat til caramelized (1 min???)
Heat to medium. Add aromatics (garlic, chilies, ginger, scallion), stir-fry for a min.
Add cabbage, wine, soy sauce, oyster sauce, sugar, and 1 tbsp water. Heat to high, cover, cook for 1-2min.
Uncover, stir in the black vinegar and salt to taste

name: chicken cabbage stirfry

items.name: balsamic vinegar
items.note: optional; to sub chinese black vinegar

directions: (1) Oil, meat. (2) Aromatics. (3) Cabbage, sauce. (4) Vinegar, gochugaru.
Chop cabbage into bite size pieces. Wash and dry.
Wok on high heat. Add oil. Sear chicken til caramelized (1 min???). Will be watery, but that's ok.
Heat to medium. Add aromatics, stir-fry for a min.
Add sauce and stir. Add cabbage and stir carefully. Heat to high, cover, cook for 2min.
Uncover, stir in the black vinegar. Cook for 1 more min.

name: winter melon soup
directions: (1) Meatball sauce. (2) Meat. (3) Oil, green onion. (4) Winter melon, water, chicken broth. (5) Black pepper, sesame oil, salt.
Make meatball sauce. Mash pork a little in large bowl, then add sauce, then whip vigorously, in one circular direction, ~10+min
Whip til thick and pasty.
Shape meatballs with oiled palms. Golf ball size. Chill on oiled plate while prepping soup.
Soak glass noodles, cold water 15 min. Drain, cut in half lengthwise.
Quarter winter melon, like a watermelon. Cut off outer 1/8 inch of dark green skin. Rinse, chop into 1/4 inch thick chunks.
In pot on med heat, add oil. Cook white part of green onion 1 min.
Add winter melon. Pour in chicken stock + water. Increase heat and bring to boil.
When boiling, carefully lower meatballs in using spoon.
Add pepper and sesame oil. Bring to boil again.
Add noodles, stir. Salt to taste. Boil for another 3-4 min, garnish with cilantro.

name: braised turnip

items.name: dried shiitake mushroom
items.note: soaked 2hr-overnight in hot water. big chunks

directions: (1) Oil, star anise, peppercorn. (2) Ginger, garlic, white part of scallion. (3) Meat. (4) Turnip, mushroom. (5) Sauce. (6) Cornstarch mix, green onion.
Heat oil in wok low heat. Add star anise and peppercorns. Let infuse the oil for 10 min (careful not to burn)
Scoop out and discard the aromatics, leaving oil in wok.
Add ginger, garlic, and white parts of scallion. Turn up heat to med-high, stir fry 1-2 min.
Add ground meat, and stir-fry til browned.
Add turnips and mushrooms. Stir and mix everything well.
Mix sauce ingredients well. Add to wok, cover, and let simmer for 15 min med heat. Turnips should be cooked thru and translucent.
Once turnips fully cooked, uncover, turn heat up to high, add cornstarch mix. Stir-fry for a min to thicken. Stir in green parts of scallions and serve.

name: shrimp with black bean sauce
directions: (1) Ground pork. (2) Oil, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, douchi. (3) Shrimp, shaoxing. (4) Sauce. (5) Cornstarch. (6) Egg. (7) Scallion.
Bring 4 to 5 cups of water to a boil in your wok. Stir in ground pork, breaking up clumps, cook for about 1 min, til no longer pink. Rinse and strain.
Wok med high heat. Add oil, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, douchi, pork. Stir-fry 20 sec.
Add shrimp. Pour Shaoxing around hot sides of wok. Stir-fry 20 sec.
Stir sauce mixture well, pour into wok. Bring to simmer, then gradually stir in cornstarch mix as needed til thickened to liking.
Pour egg across surface of the sauce. Simmer for 10 sec to set egg, then use spatula to fold egg into sauce with a few strokes. Fold in scallion, serve.

name: rou zao fan
directions: (1) Ginger, shallot. (2) Mushroom. (3) Pork, star anise. (4) Shaoxing. (5) Sauce, water. (6) Eggs. (7) Green onion.
Rehydrate mushrooms. Reserve soaking water (without sediments...). Squeeze mushrooms, dice into 1/4 inch pieces.
Wok med heat. Add 2 tbsp oil, cook ginger + shallot til shallots translucent (1-2 min).
Stir in mushrooms. Cook 2 min.
Heat to high. Add 1 tbsp oil, pork, star anise. Cook til meat opaque.
Stir in Shaoxing to deglaze. Add sauce and 2 cup water.
Bring to boil. Once boiling, cover, reduce heat to med, simmer for 20 min.
Meanwhile, hard-boil eggs (10 min in boiling water) and peel.
Once pork simmered for 20 min, add eggs. Make sure eggs are submerged. If not enough liquid to do so, add another 1/2-1 cup water.
Cover and simmer another 10 min.
Uncover. If sauce too thin, turn heat to med high and reduce, sitrring carefully to not break egg. Stir in green onion.

name: easy laghman

items.name: beef chuck stew
items.note: cubed or strips. any cut fine? bone-on is bonus

items.name: roma tomato
items.note: diced. can sub 1 tbsp tomato paste

items.name: daikon
items.note: to sub rutabaga. diced. celery even ok

items.name: balsamic vinegar
items.note: to sub black vinegar for garnish

directions: (1) Oil, meat. (2) Onion, garlic. (3) Tomato. (4) Rest of veg. (5) Spices + water. (6) Pasta. (7) Garnish.
In large pot, heat oil med-high heat.
Add beef, cook uncovered ~5min til browned.
Add onion + garlic, cook on med til soft.
Add tomatoes, cook 2 min, stirring as needed. Add rest of veg and saute a few min.
Add leftover bone from meat, if any, and spices. Pour water into pot, bring to a boil, then turn heat to low and simmer ~25-40min til meat tender and veg soft.
Remove bones, anise, and bay leaves.
Put cooked noodles in deep bowls, then top with soup and garnish.

name: pad see ew
directions: Soak noodles. Make sauce. Separate broccoli stems and leaves. Cut leaves into halves or thirds. Cut stems into bite size, thinner pieces.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in wok, high heat.
Add garlic, cook 15 sec. Add chicken, cook til mosty changed from pink to white.
Add broccoli stems, cook til chicken is almost cooked through.
Add broccoli leaves, cook ti just wilted.
Push everything to one side, crack egg in and scramble. Remove everything onto a plate.
Heat another 1 tbsp on high heat.
Add noodles, let crisp. Add sauce. Toss together. Add chicken and broccoli back in, toss, serve.

name: pad thai
directions: Boil noodles. Rinse under cold water.
Mix fish sauce, sugar, rice vinegar, water, chili powder.
Heat skillet, add oil, cook garlic.
Cook tofu, add noodles, cook for 30 seconds.
Cook egg, add sauce.
Stir in peanut.

name: pad kra pao

items.name: jalapeno
items.note: deseeded, thinly sliced. to sub Thai bird chilies

directions: (1) Shallots, garlic. (2) Chilies. (3) Pork. (4) Sauce. (5) Water. (6) Basil.
Wok med high heat. Add oil, shallots and garlic. Fry 3 min.
Add chilies, cook 1min.
Heat to high. Add pork, breaking it up.
Add sauce. Fry another min. Deglaze with water, which will cook off very fast from the high heat.
Add basil. Stir fry til wilted.

name: pad tua fak yuay

items.name: long bean
items.note: or french green bean. cut to 2"

directions: (1) Oil, garlic, shallots. (2) Long bean. (3) Sauce.
Wok med high heat. Add oil, shallots and garlic. Fry until golden brown.
Add beans, toss quickly.
Add sauce. Cook, stirring, until water is reduced.

name: summer rolls
directions: Wet rice papers in hot water to soften. Fill and roll.

name: kmg summer rolls
directions: Bring water to boil. Cook chicken (30min?). Shred or divide into pieces.
(If making side soup, in remaining chicken water, cook 1 cubed daikon/winter melon til soft.)
Toast garlic in saucepan til softened. Mix all sauce ingredients together and add to saucepan.
Cook sauce a little bit. Add mashed ginger to sauce and let cool.
Wet rice papers in hot water to soften. Fill and roll. Serve with sauce and soup!

name: khao man gai
directions: Poached chicken:
Take chicken out of fridge 30min before cooking.
Fill large saucepan with water (about 6c for 1.5lb chicken) + flavorings so that chicken will be submerged under 2 inches of water.
Bring water to boil. Place chicken in water. Cover.
Bring back up to boil, then IMMEDIATELY move saucepan off heat. Set it aside for 30min (up to 45min ok, up to 1hr acceptable).
Remove chicken from water. Slice or shred.
Sauce:
Toast garlic in saucepan til softened. Mix all sauce ingredients together and add to saucepan.
Cook sauce a little bit. Add mashed ginger to sauce and let cool.

name: thai red curry
directions: (1) Kabocha. (2) Coconut milk. (3) Curry paste. (4) Chicken. (5) Chicken stock, fish sauce, sugar. (6) Basil, red pepper.
Wash kabocha and slice any blemishes from skin, but leave skin on. Scrape out seeds and cut into bite-size cubes.

Bring 1/2 c of coconut milk to a boil on med-heat (5/10) Dutch oven. Add curry paste and stir to break up lumps. Continue cooking and reducing over med high heat til very thick and (ideally but not necessarily) coconut oil starts to separate from the curry paste.
Add chicken, toss to mix.
Add rest of coconut milk and chicken stock, season with fish sauce and sugar. Stir and simmer ~8min (4/10). Cook for 30-40 min if whole chicken.
Stir in kabocha and simmer ~5-13 min or til kabocha is fully cooked.
Remove from heat. Adjust seasoning as needed with fish sauce. Stir in basil and red pepper.

name: thai green curry
directions: (1) Coconut milk. (2) Curry paste. (3) Chicken thigh. (4) Kaffir lime leaves, chicken stock, sugar, fish sauce. (5) Bell pepper, basil.
In Dutch oven, med heat (5/10), reduce 3/4c of the coconut milk til thick and coconut oil starts to separate from the milk. (If no separation but thick, fine to proceed)
Add curry paste and saute, stirring constantly over med heat 2min til aromatic. If paste sticks, deglaze with a little bit of the remaining coconut milk.
Add chicken thigh, stir to mix.
Add lime, chicken stock, remaining coconut milk, sugar, fish sauce. Bring to simmer, gently simmer 10-15min or til chicken is fork tender (4/10). Cook for 45 min if whole chicken.
Add bell pepper and basil. Taste and add more fish sauce as needed.

name: thai yellow curry

items.name: palm sugar
items.note: reduced from the original 1.5T, which was to sub tamarind paste

directions: (1) Coconut milk. (2) Curry paste. (3) Chicken thigh. (4) Water, sugar, fish sauce, tamarind. (5) Potato, onion. (6) Cherry tomato.
In Dutch oven, med heat (5/10), reduce 3/4c of the coconut milk til thick and coconut oil starts to separate from the milk. (If no separation but thick, fine to proceed)
Add curry paste and saute, stirring constantly over med-low heat 2-3min til aromatic, til oil starts to separate from the paste.
Add chicken, stir to mix.
Add remaining coconut milk, water sugar, fish sauce, tamarind. Bring to simmer, gently simmer for 30 min (4/10).
Add potato, onion, more water if needed to mostly submerge potatoes. Simmer 15-20 more min, or til chicken fork tender and potatoes fully cooked.
Turn off heat, stir in tomatoes, let sit for a few min to let tomatoes gently cook.

name: thai curry with chicken breast

items.name: palm sugar
items.note: reduced from the original 1.5T, which was to sub tamarind paste

directions: (1) Coconut milk. (2) Curry paste. (3) Chicken breast. (4) Water, sugar, fish sauce, tamarind. (5) Potato, onion. (6) Cherry tomato.
In Dutch oven, med heat (5/10), reduce 3/4c of the coconut milk til thick and coconut oil starts to separate from the milk. (If no separation but thick, fine to proceed)
Add curry paste and saute, stirring constantly over med-low heat 2-3min til aromatic, til oil starts to separate from the paste.
Add whole chicken, stir to cover in sauce.
Add remaining coconut milk, water sugar, fish sauce, tamarind. Bring to simmer, gently simmer for 30 min (4/10) covered. Turn over halfway through cooking and re-cover.
Once chicken is cooked, remove from pot and set aside.
Add potato, onion, more water if needed to mostly submerge potatoes. Simmer 15-20 more min (4/10), or til potatoes fully cooked.
Turn off heat, stir in tomatoes, let sit for a few min to let tomatoes gently cook.

name: easy laksa
directions: (1) Oil, curry paste. (2) Curry powder, chicken. (3) Coconut milk, chicken stock. (4) Shrimp. (5) Fish balls. (6) Tofu puffs. (7) Fish sauce, sugar.
Heat oil on wok/saucepan over med-high heat (6/10). Add curry paste and cook, stirring and cooking for 30 sec or til fragrant.
Add curry powder and stir fry quickly til just mixed. Add chicken and stir-fry for 1 min.
Add coconut milk and chicken stock. Bring to a boil at the same heat, then once boiling, turn down to med heat (5/10). (Keep at this heat for the rest of cooking)
Add fish balls. Simmer for 2 min.
Add shrimp. Simmer for 2 min.
Add tofu puffs. Simmer for 1 more min. (Important to stagger the proteins to cook well! Do not add at once.)
Stir through fish sauce and sugar.
Ladle laksa over noodles, top with mung bean sprouts, egg, and coriander leaves.

name: chicken adobo
directions: Marinate chicken for at least 20 min (up to overnight).
Heat 1 tbsp oil on skillet over high heat.
Remove chicken from marinade (reserve marinade) and onto pan.
Sear both sides til brown (~1 min per side). Don't cook all the way through. Put chicken aside.
Heat remaining oil (or use chicken grease!), cook garlic and onion for 1.5 min.
Add marinade, water, sugar, black pepper. Bring it to simmer then turn heat down to med high. Simmer 5 min.
Add chicken smooth side down.
Simmer uncovered for 20~25 min (no need to stir), turning chicken at ~15 min, until sauce reduces down to thick jam-like syrup.

name: nilagang baka
directions: (1) Meat. (2) Onion, peppercorn, fish sauce. (3) Corn. (4) Potato. (5) Green beans, cabbage.
Blanch meat (optional): Place beef in pot with enough cold water to cover. Bring to boil over med heat, skimming skum that floats on top.
Drain the meat, discard the liquid, rinse meat and pot well.
Return rinsed meat to pot, cover with cold water. Over med heat, bring to boil, skimming skum on top again.
When clear of froth, add onions, peppercorns, and fish sauce.
Lower heat, cover and cook at no more than a simmer for 2.5 hrs or til shanks tender. Add more water as needed during cooking to maintain about 6-7 cups.
Add corn and cook for 5-7 min.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 min or til almost tender.
Add green beans and cabbage and cook another 2-4 min or til vegetables are tender yet crisp.
Season with salt to taste. Garnish with optional green onions.
Keeps in fridge 3 days. Reheat on med heat til 165F.

name: vietnamese bun
directions: Marinate chicken for 30min-1hr.
Combine nuoc cham ingredients and stir until sugar completely dissolved. Adjust if desired.
Boil, drain, rinse vermicelli.
Heat 2 tbsp oil in skilllet, med high heat (6/10).
Sear chicken 3 min each side. Pour in marinade and some water, then cover and cook for 7-10 min on med low (4/10) heat. Set aside.
Slice chicken thighs and add to salad.
Combine all ingredients. Serve with nuoc cham sauce.
(Original chicken cooking instructions: 2 tbsp oil med high heat (8/10). Sear chicken for 3 min one side, 5 min other (or til cooked thru). Set aside.)

name: banh mi
directions: Toss carrot and radish with sugar, salt, vinegar. Set aside 1 hr, stir occasionally.
Marinate chicken 1-4 hrs.
Heat 2 tsp oil in skilllet, med high heat (6/10).
Sear chicken 3 min each side. Pour in marinade and some water, then cover and cook for 7-10 min on med low (4/10) heat.
Mix sauce. Assemble sandwich.

name: banh trang nurong
directions: Note: if rice paper is made of tapioca, and not rice, it may shatter and be difficult to cook/eat. Try wetting two pieces of rice paper and cook on pan to fuse. Else, just use the dry rice paper sheet.
Place rice paper on a dry nonstick or cast iron pan on low med (or med high???) heat.
Place green onion on top with well in center for egg. Either crack egg on top and swirl carefully, or spoon on beaten egg.
Let cook. Add sausage on top.
Squeeze over the top of the filling mayo and sriracha.
(Try to) fold over in half and cook til rice paper is crispy.
To cook sausage: put sausage in pot with enough water to cover. Bring water to boil, then continue cooking til easily pierced with chopstick (10-20min).

name: curry braised collard greens with salmon

items.name: collard greens bunch
items.note: stems removed and cut to large strips

directions: (1) Oil, shallot, garlic, ginger. (2) Spice mix 1. (3) Broth, coconut milk, spice mix 2. (4) Collards. (5) Salmon.
In Dutch oven, heat oil over med heat. Add shallot, garlic, ginger, and saute while stirring 1-2 min til aromatic and shallots soft.
Mix turmeric, fenugreek, black pepper, cumin. Saute another min. If too dry, add another tsp oil as needed.
Add broth, coconut milk, sugar, salt as needed, cinnamon stick, bay leaf, star anise, cloves, cardamom. Stir and bring to low simmer.
Add collards and toss to coat. Cover and simmer 15 min.
Remove lid, push collards to outer edges to leave space in middle for salmon.
Add salmon. Simmer 5-7 min while continuously spooning the braising liquid over salmon. Bottom of salmons should start looking opaque.

Sprinkle a bit of salt and pepper on the salmon. Transfer uncovered Dutch oven to broiler (or oven at 475F?) to finish cooking salmon through, about 8-10 min depending on thickness (internal temp 125F-145F).
Serve salmon and greens over rice.

name: crispy brown rice
directions: Crispy kale:
1 bunch kale + 1 T olive oil + 1 tsp salt
Remove kale leaves from thick stems. Tear into bite size pieces about 2-3 inches.
Wash and very thoroughly dry kale. Drizzle leaves with oil, toss to combine. Spread evenly onto baking sheet without overlapping and sprinkle with salt.
Bake at 300F til edges start to brown but not burnt, 20-30 min.
Let leaves cool completely, then store 2-3 days in partially closed container room temp.
Bake sweet potato at 400F for 1hr, placing about 30 min before tofu goes into oven.
Press and dry tofu for 15+min. Cut into 1-inch cubes.
Mix all tofu sauce ingredients. Toss tofu in sauce.
Place on lined baking sheet, no pieces touching. Bake 25-30 min 400F, stirring 2-3 times to evenly bake.
Poach eggs:
Mix 1c water + 1c vinegar in large bowl. Crack cold eggs in gently right above water surface.
Let eggs sit 10min (eggs should turn lightly white and opaque).
Bring 3-4qt pot (half filled with water) to a gentle simmer--tiny bubbles on bottom and should be steaming.
Use ladle to gently scoop up each egg (carry a little bit of vinegar with it) and gently drop into water.
Cook for 2-3 min.
Garnish with mint and cilantro and pickles.

name: vague peanut butter flakes
directions: (1) Garlic, veg. (2) Egg. (3) Noodle, sauce. (4) Garnish.
Mix sauce ingredients.
Soak noodle in warm water.
Heat oil in skillet, high heat. Stir fry garlic and veg til softer. Crack in egg and scramble.
Add noodle and sauce. Stir fry for a bit.
Add garnish. Quickly cook, and serve.

name: california roll noodle
directions: Cook noodle. (If using dry udon, boil water on high? or any heat? Add noodle and cook in boiling water for 4 min, then drain.)
Cut vegetables. Add noodles. Toss in sugar, salt, and a splash of rice vinegar. Combine

name: bean and hogao tacos

items.name: paprika
items.note: or turmeric/saffron. to sub ground annatto

directions: Hogao:
In small saucepan, cook all hogao ingredients plus the Sazon over med-low heat 10-15min stirring often. Remove from heat, set aside.
Tortillas:
Mix dry in a bowl. Stir in wet. Mix, then knead til smooth.
Separate into 9 balls, lightly flatten with palm. Cover and let rest 15min to up to 2 hrs.
Nonstick pan on med heat. (Maybe try slightly above med heat?)
Flatten each ball with rolling pin. Should be pretty thin and translucent!
Heat each tortilla. First side for 1 min (should have lightly browned spots. if not, heat is too low. if it takes less than 1 min, heat is too high). Other side for 15-30 sec.
Keep warm til ready to serve. Store room temp for 24hrs or fridge for up to 1 week.

name: bean and cheese quesadillas

items.name: dried pinto bean
items.note: soaked then cooked to make 1c cooked

directions: Mash beans, and mix in shredded mozzarella.
Tortillas:
Mix dry in a bowl. Stir in wet. Mix, then knead til smooth.
Separate into 6 balls, lightly flatten with palm. Cover and let rest 15min to up to 2 hrs.
Nonstick pan on med heat. (Maybe try slightly above med heat?)
Flatten each ball with rolling pin. Should be pretty thin and translucent!
Heat each tortilla. First side for 1 min (should have lightly browned spots. if not, heat is too low. if it takes less than 1 min, heat is too high). Other side for 15-30 sec.

Heat up skillet over med heat and add olive oil. Once hot, add tortilla and heat on each side for about 30 sec or until pliable. Spread bean cheese mix, fold tortilla and cook 2 min each side til golden.

name: birthday burritos
directions: Pico de Gallo:
Slice tomato into 1/3" cubes (1/3" slices, then cut into 1/3" sticks, then diced). Toss with 1/2 tsp salt and let strain for 30 min.
Soak onion in 1c water + 1T baking soda for 15 min. Rinse thoroughly.
Mix onion, chopped cilantro, diced jalapeno, lime juice, and tomato. Lasts 2-3 days in fridge.
Tortilla:
Mix dry in a bowl. Stir in wet. Mix, then knead til smooth.
Separate into 12 balls, lightly flatten with palm. Cover and let rest 15min to up to 2 hrs.
Nonstick pan on med heat. (Maybe try slightly above med heat?)
Flatten each ball with rolling pin. Should be pretty thin and translucent!
Heat each tortilla. First side for 1 min (should have lightly browned spots. if not, heat is too low. if it takes less than 1 min, heat is too high). Other side for 15-30 sec.
Keep warm til ready to serve. Store room temp for 24hrs or fridge for up to 1 week.

name: stuffing
directions: (1) Oil. (2) Vegetables, black pepper, parsley, salt. (3) Bread. (4) Water, soy sauce, spices.
Add 2 tbsp olive oil in Dutch oven, med heat. Add vegetables, black pepper, parsley, and salt. Cook vegetables until soft.
Add bread. Mix and add 1.5c water, soy sauce, and spices.
Turn heat to low and let cook until bread soft and water dissolved.

name: thanksgiving meal
directions: Stuffing:
Add 2 tbsp olive oil in Dutch oven, med heat. Add vegetables, black pepper, parsley, and salt. Cook vegetables until soft.
Add bread. Mix and add 1.5c water, soy sauce, and spices.
Turn heat to low and let cook until bread soft and water dissolved.
To reheat rotisserie:
Place chicken in oven-safe dish. Pour 1c of broth on the bottom and cover tightly with foil.
Bake at 350F for 25 min.
Note: opened cranberry sauce lasts airtight in fridge 10-14 days. Leftover chicken lasts in fridge 3-4 days, or freeze and thaw overnight!

name: rotisserie chicken and bread
directions: Day 1: Mix biga ingredients (yeast is a VERY scant 3/4 tsp). Let ferment 15-18hr room temp.
Day 2: Mix flour, yeast (1/2 of 1/8 tsp), salt, yogurt, water, and biga in mixer. Med low speed 2 min til dough comes together.
Use up to 85g more water if needed to make soft dough?
Cover and ferment dough at room temp 2hr. Then, keep in fridge overnight (~15h).
Day 3: Take dough out of fridge, rest for 2hr at rom temp.
Dough onto floured surface. Gently (dont crush the air bubbles!) fold onto itself like a letter.
Turn 90deg, fold again, then shape into ball. Place on parchment paper. Place large bowl over, and proof again 1-2 hr til double and doesnt spring back when poked.
45min before dough is ready, preheat oven to 450F with Dutch oven inside.
Carefully place dough into hot Dutch oven. Bake 30 min with lid on, then remove lid and bake til golden brown.
Cool on rack 20min.
To reheat rotisserie:
Place chicken in oven-safe dish. Pour 1c of broth on the bottom and cover tightly with foil.
Bake at 350F for 25 min.
Note: opened cranberry sauce lasts airtight in fridge 10-14 days. Leftover chicken lasts in fridge 3-4 days, or freeze and thaw overnight!

name: 3 avocado toast lunches
directions: Day 1: Mix biga ingredients (yeast is a VERY scant 3/4 tsp). Let ferment 15-18hr room temp.
Day 2: Mix flour, yeast (1/2 of 1/8 tsp), salt, yogurt, water, and biga in mixer. Med low speed 2 min til dough comes together.
Use up to 85g more water if needed to make soft dough?
Cover and ferment dough at room temp 2hr. Then, keep in fridge overnight (~15h).
Day 3: Take dough out of fridge, rest for 2hr at rom temp.
Dough onto floured surface. Gently (dont crush the air bubbles!) fold onto itself like a letter.
Turn 90deg, fold again, then shape into ball. Place on parchment paper. Place large bowl over, and proof again 1-2 hr til double and doesnt spring back when poked.
45min before dough is ready, preheat oven to 450F with Dutch oven inside.
Carefully place dough into hot Dutch oven. Bake 30 min with lid on, then remove lid and bake til golden brown.
Cool on rack 20min.

name: tuna salad
directions: If using tuna in water, drain and mix in olive oil.
Mix ingredients and enjoy.

name: crab salad
directions: Mix. add chopped pickles if you want

name: shrimp skagen

ingredients.category: 1/2 recipe of the buckwheat loaf bread

directions: Thaw frozen raw shrimp in bowl in fridge overnight (8-10hr).
Peel shell off, starting from head-end of the legs. Leave tail on.
Use sharp paring knife to cut along the outside of the spine, a quarter of the way into the flesh. Peel apart the cut, and devein by pulling out the vein.
Place water in 4-qt pot, filled half with water. Add 2 bay leaves. Bring water to boil on high heat.
When boiling, add the shrimp. Wait until the water is boiling again, then let shrimp cook for 1 more min.
Drain shrimp, rinse under cold water until shrimps are cooled on the outside. Remove the tails.
Coarsely chop half of the shrimp. Cut rest of the shrimp into about 4 pieces.
Finely chop dill. Mix shrimp, dill, lemon zest, yogurt, mustard, salt, pepper. Let sit 1 hr in fridge.
Serve on about 4 slices of bread, squeeze lemon juice on top, and top with sliced egg and capers.

name: egg salad
directions: Hard boil eggs for 12 min. Separate yolk and white.
Dice whites, mix yolk with all other ingredients, then mix all together.
Good with 42% of shokupan recipe for 1 lunch.

name: hot egg sandwich
directions: Scramble eggs. Sandwich with mayo, tomato, and scrambled eggs.

name: steamed egg sandwich
directions: Dinner rolls:
Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into 9 balls. Let rise ~30min.
Bake in buttered lined 8x8 dish at 355F 30-35 min or til lightly browned.
Grease 8x8 baking dish.
Whisk eggs til just combined. Whisk in rest of ingredients til just combined. Try blending everything.
Pour into dish through a sieve. Cover tight with foil. Place dish inside 9x13 baking dish, pour water in big pan til just to top of the egg mix.
Bake at 325F til just set 40 min-1hr 20 min.

name: quiche
directions: Day 1:
For crust:
Combine flour, salt, sugar. (Food processor: pulse til well combined)
Add the butter, half at a time. (Pulse 8 times, add, then pulse 6 times)
Slowly add ice water + vinegar mix. (Pulse several times each time you add.)
Should be crumbly dough that holds together when you squish it.
Form dough into a disk, wrap and chill in fridge for at least 30min-1 hour.. Work dough just enough to bring together, too much will make it tough.
Remove from fridge and let sit for 10-15 min. Roll out once soft.
Place in foil-lined 6" cake pan. Freeze til ready to cook.
Day 2:
To blindbake crust:
Bake at 425F for 12-15min with pie weights, til edges golden. Remove pie weights, let bake til bottom of crust looks dry, about 5min.
Brush bottom with egg wash, bake for 1 more min. Sprinkle a bit of the parmesan on the bottom, bake another 2 more min.
Let crust cool.
Place non-custard fillings on the bottom of the crust.
Whisk eggs. Whisk in rest of custard ingredients except parmesan.
Pour custard over fillings. Sprinkle parmesan on top.
Bake at 325F for 35-45min til light wobble in center. Cool and enjoy.

name: fancy salad
directions: Enjoy your FANCY salad

name: perilla seed cabbage salad
directions: Enjoy your FANCY salad

name: blintzes

items.name: farmers cheese
items.note: chilled. (this will be an entire 16oz WF container)

directions: Makes 16.
Whisk all pancake ingredients together til smooth and combined. Blender fine. Let rest covered room temp at least 1hr.
Mix zest, farmers cheese, sugar, egg, cream cheese, vanilla, salt and blend til light and smooth. (Keep in fridge til using)
8 inch nonstick pan. Grease with melted butter. Cook on medium heat. Add batter, tilting and swirling.
Cook just one side til top is matte and not shiny, lightly golden edges. (~1min?)
With cooked side facing up, fill with filling in the center (~4in long?). Fold bottom up, then the sides, then roll up.
(Freeze now if you want)
On nonstick med heat, grease with butter. Fry blintzes seam side down til golden (few min per side).
Serve with compote or honey.
To cook from frozen, put frozen onto buttered pan med heat. Cook each side til golden, then turn down heat to 3/10 and cover for a few min to steam (5-10 min).

name: syrniki

items.name: farmers cheese
items.note: (this will be an entire WF container)

directions: Beat egg and sugar until smooth.
Beat in salt and farmer's cheese until well mixed.
Add flour and mix til just combined. Rest batter in fridge while pan heats up.
Fry on nonstick pan med low heat (4/10). Makes 15 syrniki (~47g batter each), cook in 2 batches.

name: egg bites
directions: Makes 12 egg bites (84cal 8.7g protein per egg bite).
Blend all (except spinach) together. Optionally can add 1 tsp hot sauce.
Pour into greased muffin tin. Top with chopped spinach.
Bake at 200F for 90 min or til slightly wobbly but not raw in center.

name: protein smoothie
directions: Blend and enjoy.

name: pb banana smoothie
directions: Blend and enjoy.

name: protein bars
directions: Mash banana. Mix all ingredients til well-combined.
Press into 8x8 pan. Refrigerate 1+hr. Press down and together tightly and cut into bars.
Store in airtight container in fridge 2 weeks. Freeze for 3 months, thaw in fridge before serving.
If cut into 24 bars, 158cal 8.66g protein per bar.

name: protein powder chocolate balls
directions: Mix all. Have in a bowl of milk.

name: date cashew protein bars
directions: Blend all and shape into bars.

name: mango lassi
directions: Blend all. Serve chilled.

name: bean smoothie

items.name: dried pinto bean
items.note: soaked then cooked to make 1c cooked

directions: Blend and enjoy.

name: smoothie bowl
directions: Blend base ingredients with patience.

name: chocolate chia pudding
directions: for thick chia: 2 tbsp for every 1/2 c (4g chia for every 20ml milk)
for thinner chia: 3 tbsp for every 1 c (3g chia for every 20ml milk)

name: pb chia pudding
directions: for thick chia: 2 tbsp for every 1/2 c (4g chia for every 20ml milk)
for thinner chia: 3 tbsp for every 1 c (3g chia for every 20ml milk)

name: big sur chia pudding
directions: Prepare to be transported back to California

name: yogurt chia pudding
directions: Stir yogurt and honey. Stir in chia. Stir in milk. After 1 min of sitting, stir again.
Chill in fridge 1+hr before serving.

name: protein powder overnight oats
directions: Mix all. Let sit in fridge overnight.

name: frozen berry overnight oats
directions: Mix all. Let sit in fridge overnight. Keeps in fridge up to 5 days.

name: pb overnight oats
directions: Mix all. Let sit in fridge overnight. Keeps in fridge up to 5 days.

name: simple greek yogurt overnight oats
directions: Mix all. Let sit in fridge overnight. Keeps in fridge up to 5 days.

name: bircher muesli
directions: Mix all. Optionally mix in grated/chopped apple.
Let sit in fridge overnight. Keeps in fridge up to 4 days.

name: french toast
directions: For 6 slices of bread.
Whisk custard ingredients. Soak bread for 15-20 min.
Fry on med heat for 3-5 min each side, in 2 batches.

name: vegan pancakes
directions: Mix dry ingredients. Separately mix wet and let sit to curdle.
Combine the two and mix, let sit for 5-15 min.
Cook 1/4 cup batter each over lightly oiled pan, med heat (5-6/10). Flip once top bubbles.

name: buttermilk pancakes
directions: Mix milk and vinegar and vanilla if using. Let curdle 5 min.
Sift dry ingredients. Whisk egg and butter into the buttermilk.
Make well in center of dry ingredients, pour in the wet. Mix gently, lumps are ok.
Lightly oiled pan on med heat (5/10), 1/4 c batter each pancake. Ready to flip when edges are just getting matte, and the center of the top is starting to have broken bubbles.
Keep cooked ones warm in oven at 200F.
Nonstick pan tips: heat up very slowly and check if heat is ready by placing a bit of butter. If butter melts and bubbles without burning, heat is ready.

name: rye pancakes with cream
directions: Combine butter and maple syrup, let cool slightly.
Stir dry ingredients. Whisk together egg, milk, butter mix. Stir wet into dry, til just combined. Let batter sit while skillet heats.
Heat skillet over low to med-low. Grease with butter if needed. When skillet is hot (flicked water should sizzle), melt a bit of butter and take a scant 1/4c of batter, pour onto skilet.
Let cook 1-2 min or til pancake begins to bubble slightly. Flip and let cook another 1-2 min til pancake cooked through.

name: baked buckwheat pancake
directions: Sift flours, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt in medium bowl. Make well in center.
In small bowl, whisk buttermilk, egg, vanilla. Pour liquids into dry, whisking slowly from center.
Preheat a 6" or 7" cast iron skillet over med low (4/10) heat on stove. Add butter (both for batter and pan) and swirl to coat ast it melts.
Pour melted butter into batter and whisk well.
Transfer batter to pan and gently spread over entire surface. Increase heat to med high (6/10).
When mixture starts to bubble around the edges (1-2 min), transfer pan to oven to bake 5-8 min at 350F (closer to 5 min), til center just set.
Carefully remove pan from oven. Flip pancake. Return to oven, bake another 1-2 min (closer to 2 min) til toothpick comes out clean.
Compote: stir all over med heat for 10 min, then another 8 min on med low heat. Will thicken as cools.

name: drop scones
directions: Mix dry ingredients. Make well in center and add egg + 100ml milk.
Beat well til smooth thick batter. Add enough milk til batter is like thick cream (probably ~166ml total).
Heat large non-stick pan (5/10 heat) and grease very slightly. Drop 12g spoons onto hot pan (12g makes tiny ones!).
Give enough space to spread. When surface bubbles, flip and cook for another 30sec-1min (til lightly golden). Cooks very fast!!

name: blini
directions: Whisk flours, salt, yeast. Make well in center, pour in milk. Whisk til smooth. Let batter rise til doubled (1hr).
Stir in butter and egg yolk into batter. Whisk egg whites in separate bowl til stiff but not dry.
Fold in whipped whites into batter. Let rest 20 more min covered.
In large nonstick skillet over med heat (let sit at 4/10 for a long time), drop 2 tbsp of batter. Do not overcrowd pan.
Cook 1 min or til bubbles form. Flip and cook 30 more sec.

name: baked oatmeal

items.name: frozen berry mix
items.note: for batter. or nuts or whatever

items.name: frozen berry mix
items.note: for topping. or nuts or whatever

directions: In large bowl, mix oats, cinnamon, baking powder, salt.
Add in milk, syrup, egg, butter, vanilla, greek yogurt. Stir to combine.
Add 1c of choice of fillings, mix to combine.
Carefully pour into buttered 8x8 baking dish. Sprinkle on toppings.
Bake at 375F for 35-40min or til top golden. Remove and let cool few min.

name: pumpkin baked oatmeal
directions: In large bowl, mix oats, baking powder, salt, all spices.
Add in milk, pumpkin, syrup, egg, butter, vanilla. Stir to combine.
Carefully pour into buttered 8x8 baking dish. Sprinkle on toppings.
Bake at 375F for 30-35min or til top golden. Remove and let cool few min.
Stores in fridge airtight 5 days or freezes 3 months. Reheat covered at 350F for 5-10min.

name: bread pudding
directions: Butter 2 8-oz ramekins (the heart ramekins work perfect). Split 1.5 cups of cubed bread evenly between the two ramekins.
Whisk all pudding ingredients and pour evenly between the two ramekins filled with bread.
Let soak 4hrs-overnight.
Bake at 335F for 30min or til barely set. Let cool at least 20 min, and enjoy warm.

name: buckwheat popovers
directions: Makes 9 popovers in muffin tin.
Whisk well milk, eggs, butter, sugar, salt. Add flours and whisk til mostly smooth (few clumps fine).
Let batter rest in fridge 5hrs-overnight. Bring back to room temp for 30 min.
Pour batter into buttered tins. Bake at 450F for 15 min, then 350F for 15 more min. Do NOT open oven door.
Take out of oven, then pierce tops to release steam. Optionally put back in oven for a few more min afterwards to crisp up.

name: dutch baby
directions: Bring eggs to room temp by placing in warm water for 5-10 min.
Whisk all ingredients til smooth. Add milk, slowly whisking while adding.
Heat 10-inch skillet (medium carbon steel). Add butter, let melt, then add batter.
Bake at 425F for 20 min, then turn off oven and let sit 5 min.
If doing apple version:
Slice 1 apple, cook in the skillet with all the butter and a pinch of salt over med heat for 5-7 min or til tender.
Once done, pour in the batter as normal and bake in oven as usual.

name: toad in a hole
directions: Bring eggs to room temp by placing in warm water for 5-10 min.
Whisk all ingredients til smooth. Add milk, slowly whisking while adding.
Let rest in fridge 30 min (cold batter = puffy edges + flatter center) or just at room temp (warm batter = overall big puff).
Cook sausages in ceramic baking dish or 10-inch skillet (med carbon steel) with oil. Bake at 410F for 12-15 min til brown.
Pour batter over sausages. Bake for ~25-30 min without opening oven til golden brown.

name: clafoutis

items.name: soy milk
items.note: extra milk to sub 1/3c heavy cream or 1/3c greek yog

directions: Whisk egg, sugar, salt 1 min til combined. Add flour til smooth and lump free.
Whisk in butter, milk, extract til completely smooth.
Pour batter into buttered 9-inch skillet pan or pie dish. Scatter fruit onto batter.
Bake at 350F/180C 35-40min til just set, wobbly ok. Cool til lukewarm and serve.

name: buckwheat crepes
directions: Makes 6 thicker crepes (or 9 thinner crepes).
Blend all batter ingredients. No lumps! Sit in fridge 2hr-overnight.
Add water (1/4-1/2c) to adjust thickness (consistency of melted ice cream).
Preheat 12-inch (largest) nonstick pan over med or med-high heat.
Lightly grease. Pour batter (~1/3 c?), tip, and swirl pan to spread very thin.
Fry for 1-2 min on each side.
To serve:
Reheat a crepe on med heat. Place cheese/ham on top, fry til crepe underside brown.
Top with fried egg and fold in crepe's edges to make into a square.

name: breakfast patties
directions: Mix all spices. Add spices to pork. Nice to let sit for a few hours to marinate.
Med heat non stick 5 min each side.

name: tempeh egg baguette
directions: Fry tempeh.
Scramble eggs.
Enjoy :)

name: breakfast tacos
directions: Make beans.
Scramble eggs.
Enjoy :)

name: matzo brei
directions: Heat up some water in a pot. Put matzo on a heat safe dish, gently pour hot water over. Let sit for a bit. Drain gently.
Whisk eggs, salt/pepper (1 tbsp sugar/some cinnamon if you want sweet). Put in wet matzo and mix.
Scramble on med low/med heat to desired doneness.
To season carbon steel pan, place lightly greased (5 drops of oil!) pan in 400F oven for 40 min, then turn off and let cool for 20 min.

name: cottage cheese sheet pancake
directions: Grease and line 9x9 inch pan.
Whisk cottage cheese, milk, and egg. Separately mix dry ingredients. Add dry to wet.
Pour batter into sheet pan and spread evenly. Tap on counter a few times to flatten. Top with berries.
Bake at 356F/180C for 25 min, rotating pan halfway through.

name: greek yogurt sheet pancake
directions: Makes 12 square pancakes (137cal 6.84g protein each)
Grease and line 18x13 inch sheet pan. (Tip, use 20x16 inches of paper)
Whisk dry ingredients. Separately whisk wet. Pour wet into dry and whisk til just combined. Lumps ok.
Pour batter into sheet pan and spread evenly. Tap on counter a few times to flatten.
Bake in middle rack 425F for 15-17 min, rotating pan halfway through.
Cool for 5 min in pan, then remove and cut.
Keeps in fridge 4 days.

name: greek yogurt waffle
directions: Makes 18 waffles. 138cal each. Enjoy with ~8g maple syrup each waffle.
Whisk eggs, then whisk with yogurt. Add milk, vanilla, butter, and mix til creamy.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt. Slowly add dry into wet. Mix gently to combine.
Cook in waffle maker ~3 min, ~70-73g batter each waffle.

name: greek yogurt mochi waffle
directions: Whisk flours, sugar, baking powder.
Whisk yogurt, water, egg. Add wet to dry and spatula til combined.
Cook in waffle maker ~3 min. Makes 12 waffles.
For savory: reduce to 2 tbsp sugar, + black pepper, cheese, green onion or any herb

name: bean waffles
directions: Makes 15 waffles?
Blend overnight soaked, drained beans with 1 c water til completely smooth. Add in rest of water
Whisk eggs, then add to beans. Add vanilla, butter, and mix til creamy.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt. Slowly add dry into wet. Mix gently to combine.
Cook in waffle maker ~3 min

name: boongeo bbang
directions: Fill with 200g canned red bean (7oz can)
Mix all dry. Whisk egg and milk. Add with oil to dry.
Pour batter onto low heat iron up to 1/3 full. Add 2 tsp red bean in the center. Cover red bean with a bit more batter.

name: waffles
directions: Preheat waffle iron to med high.
Make buttermilk by combining milk and vinegar. Set aside to curdle.
Melt and cool butter.
Whisk buttermilk, butter, vanilla, and egg yolk well.
Sift dry ingredients. Pour wet into dry ingredients and mix.
Beat egg whites to stiff peaks. Fold whites into batter gradually and mix gently.
Use a scant 1/3 cup of batter per waffle. Makes about 6 small waffles.
Good with 2 tbsp of black sesame powder and ~60g chestnut jam.

name: biscuits
directions: Make buttermilk by replacing 1tbsp w vinegar. So, 1/16 of liquid amount is vinegar, 15/16 of liquid amount is milk.
Stir dry together. Cut in the frozen fat (use a veg peeler!). Make well in center and stir in liquid.
Knead about 10 times. (Do the book fold thing ~3 times)
Roll to 1 inch thick and cut out (dont twist!!) or slice with knife, and clean cutter between each cutting.
Have biscuits right next to each other so the sides touch (so they stay soft). Optional, brush tops with buttermilk.
Bake at 425F for 15 min.
(To freeze: Cut, dont brush tops, cover with plastic wrap and freeze. Cook at 475F from frozen (brush now if you want) for 7 min, then keep door closed, turn oven off, leave for 5 more min.)

name: 1 pie crust
directions: For one 9-inch pie crust:
Combine flour, salt, sugar. (Food processor: pulse til well combined)
Add the butter, half at a time. (Pulse 8 times, add, then pulse 6 times)
Slowly add ice water + vinegar mix. (Pulse several times each time you add.)
Should be crumbly dough that holds together when you squish it.
Form dough into a disk, wrap and chill in fridge for at least 30min-1 hour.. Work dough just enough to bring together, too much will make it tough.
Remove from fridge and let sit for 10-15 min. Roll out once soft.
Freeze til ready to cook.
To blindbake:
Bake at 425F for 12-15min with pie weights, til edges golden. Remove pie weights, let bake til bottom of crust looks dry, about 5min.
If making a crust for a pie that will need no further baking, bake for a few more min after that.
For mini heart ramekin pies:
Make about 1/3 of recipe? Bake at 425F for 30-35min?
For 5 pop tarts:
Cut out 10 4x3 rectangles. Place 1.25T of jam in center. Egg wash the rims and press top and bottom together. Chill for 30 min, then bake at 375F for 25min or til golden, rotating halfway.
Cool on baking pan 5 min, then transfer to wire rack. Once completely cool, frost (45g powdered sugar, 1/2T milk, 1/4tsp vanilla), and let harden 1 hr.

name: double pie crust
directions: For 2 pie crusts: 44% for a 6-inch cake pan deep dish pie, 56% for a regular 9-inch crust.
Food processor: pulse flour, butter, salt til texture of fine breadcrumbs.
Slowly add ice water + vinegar mix, pulsing several times each time you add.
Should be crumbly dough that holds together when you squish it.
Form dough into a disk, wrap and chill in fridge for at least 30min-1 hour.. Work dough just enough to bring together, too much will make it tough.
Remove from fridge and let sit for 10-15 min. Roll out once soft.
Freeze til ready to cook.
To blindbake:
Bake at 425F for 12-15min with pie weights, til edges golden. Remove pie weights, let bake til bottom of crust looks dry, about 5min.
If making a crust for a pie that will need no further baking, bake for a few more min after that.

name: tortillas
directions: Mix dry in a bowl. Stir in wet. Mix, then knead til smooth.
Separate into 9 balls, lightly flatten with palm. Cover and let rest 15min to up to 2 hrs.
Nonstick pan on med heat. (Maybe try slightly above med heat?)
Flatten each ball with rolling pin. Should be pretty thin and translucent!
Heat each tortilla. First side for 1 min (should have lightly browned spots. if not, heat is too low. if it takes less than 1 min, heat is too high). Other side for 15-30 sec.
Keep warm til ready to serve. Store room temp for 24hrs or fridge for up to 1 week.

name: pizza
directions: 2 10-12 inch pizzas (King Arthur pizza dough)
Stir all ingredients into rough, cohesive dough. Cover and rise 12-24 hrs at room temp.
After this rise, either use as is, or keep in fridge for up to 48 hrs. (If fridged, let come to room temp before shaping.)

Divide into 2 balls. For each ball, stretch at both ends, fold back into itself, then repeat with other two ends. Pull ends of dough into the middle, turn over, and pull into itself to make smooth ball.
Place ball seam side down into lightly oiled bowl. Cover and rise 45min-1hr while preheating oven.
On a floured surface, sprinkle top with flour. Use fingers to gently press surface, leaving the crust alone. Lift and use knuckles to stretch into circle.
Bake as hot as you can til browned, 6-12min. Remove and top with parmesan.
If frozen dough, let thaw for 2 days and remove 3 hrs before baking.
If doing egg pizza: 480F, cook pizza for 5 min, remove and top with egg, and cook for another 9 min.

name: dinner rolls
directions: Makes 6 rolls:
Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into balls. Let rise ~30min.
Bake at 355F 20-30 min or til lightly browned. (Bake at 300-305F for 14 min for pale buns.)
Fits nicely in 6-inch round cake pan.

name: pizza rolls
directions: Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into balls. Let rise ~30min.
Bake at 355F 20-30 min or til lightly browned. (Bake at 300-305F for 14 min for pale buns.)
Fits nicely in 6-inch round cake pan.

name: basil tomato pizza buns
directions: Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into balls. Let rise ~30min.
Bake at 355F 20-30 min or til lightly browned. Or 347F/175C for 15 min.

name: sausage bread
directions: Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into balls. Let rise ~30min.
Bake at 355F 20-30 min or til lightly browned.

name: curry beef buns
directions: Makes 3 buns.
Filling:
Heat large pot over med high heat. Add beef and break up. Saute til beef releases some oil (~2-3 min).
Lower heat to medium. Add onion and garlic and saute til onions soft (~4-5 min).
Season with curry powder, salt, sugar. Stir and cook 1-2 min
Reduce heat to med-low. Add soy sauce and stir. Deglaze bottom with water.
Chill filling in fridge 1-2 hours.
Dough:
Warm milk + water, yeast, sugar. Mix and let sit.
Mix flour, salt, and add wet. Mix til incorporated.
Add softened butter, knead til smooth and windowpane test.
Let double (~40min). Divide into pieces, let rest 15 min at room temp.
Deflate, knead, shape into balls. Roll each ball into 5" diameter, with thinner edges. Fill, pinch, and shape.
Let rise til slightly puffy (~30 min).
Bake at 375F 15-16 min or til lightly golden or internal temp of 190F.
Store in fridge 1 week or freeze 3 months. Microwave for 30 sec (or 1 min if frozen)

name: challah
directions: Combine yeast, warm water, and 1/2 tsp sugar. Stir and let sit ~5min, til foamy
Whisk eggs, oil, sugar.
Mix flour, salt, sugar. Add yeast and wet ingredients.
Stir to combine. Knead til smooth and slightly sticky dough (7-10min).
Place dough in oiled bowl, cover, and let it sit room temperature until doubled in size, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Alternatively, you can refrigerate it overnight and then let it sit room temp 1 hr.

Shape. Transfer loaf to lined baking sheet and let rise, covered, at room temp for 30 min, til slightly puffy. (can also fridge overnight right after shaping, then let come to room temp and rise 1 hr)
Brush with egg + 1 tbsp water for egg wash. Optional poppy/sesame seed garnish.
Bake at 375F 20-28 min (internal temp 190F). (Take out halfway and reapply more egg wash, then rotate loaf for even browning)
Store few days room temp, 3 months frozen.

name: challah 2
directions: Combine yeast, 1/2c warm water, and 1 tsp sugar. Stir and let sit ~5min, til foamy
Whisk eggs, oil, water.
Mix flour, salt, sugar. Add yeast and wet ingredients.
Stir to combine. Knead til smooth and slightly sticky dough (7-10min).
Place dough in oiled bowl, cover, and let it sit room temperature until doubled in size, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Alternatively, you can refrigerate it overnight and then let it sit room temp 1 hr.

Shape. Transfer loaf to lined baking sheet and let rise, covered, at room temp for 30 min, til slightly puffy. (can also fridge overnight right after shaping, then let come to room temp and rise 1 hr)
Brush with egg + 1 tbsp water for egg wash. Optional poppy/sesame seed garnish.
Bake at 375F 20-28 min (internal temp 190F). (Take out halfway and reapply more egg wash, then rotate loaf for even browning)
Store few days room temp, 3 months frozen.

name: brioche
directions: Beat flour, eggs, milk, yeast til combined.
Add butter, sugar, salt. Mix til smooth and elastic.
Let double (1-2hrs)
Punch down and shape in 9x5 pan. Let rise 20 more min.
Bake in 9x5 pan at 390F for 25min or til golden.

name: fake sourdough
directions: Day 1: Mix biga ingredients (yeast is a VERY scant 3/4 tsp). Let ferment 15-18hr room temp.
Day 2: Mix flour, yeast (1/2 of 1/8 tsp), salt, yogurt, water, and biga in mixer. Med low speed 2 min til dough comes together.
Use up to 85g more water if needed to make soft dough?
Cover and ferment dough at room temp 2hr. Then, keep in fridge overnight (~15h).
Day 3: Take dough out of fridge, rest for 2hr at rom temp.
Dough onto floured surface. Gently (dont crush the air bubbles!) fold onto itself like a letter.
Turn 90deg, fold again, then shape into ball. Place on parchment paper. Place large bowl over, and proof again 1-2 hr til double and doesnt spring back when poked.
45min before dough is ready, preheat oven to 450F with Dutch oven inside.
Carefully place dough into hot Dutch oven. Bake 30 min with lid on, then remove lid and bake til golden brown.
Cool on rack 20min.

name: rustic yogurt boule
directions: Whisk flour, salt, yeast. Add water and yogurt and mix til incorporated.
Cover and let rise 5 hrs room temp.

Heavily flour hands and surface. Shape dough by folding side closest to you up, then each side of dough in towards each other. Then, fold farthest side of dough towards yourself. Using side closest to you, flip dough over so smooth bottom is on top.
Cup hands and shape into tigh ball. Transfer to dusted parchment paper, cover with bowl, and let rest 30 min. Preheat Dutch oven now.
Bake at 450F in hot Dutch oven with lid on for 30 min. Remove lid and let top brown (10-15 min).
Cool on wire rack.

name: french country bread
directions: Day 1: Mix starter ingredients into thick pudding. Cover and let rest in fridge overnight (16h).
Day 2:
Stir down starter with spoon and add water, yeast, sugar, 390g of flour, salt. Mix into a loose, messy mass. Let rest 15min (very important!)
Knead rested mass, using up to 90g more flour as needed for a soft dough. Knead for 10-12min.
Place dough into lightly greased bowl, cover, and let rest til doubled (or overnight).
Day 3:
Deflate dough GENTLY (we want to keep the bubbles). Form into a round ball. Place onto parchment paper seam down. Let rise til 50% larger (45-90min).
Slash the top. Bake in pre-heated Dutch oven 475F, 25min covered, 10 uncovered. 190F internal temp.
Store for a couple days room temp.

name: focaccia

ingredients.category: toppings. mix and let infuse a bit

directions: Half sheet pan (18x13 inch) with 1 inch edges.
Day 1:
Whisk yeast in water in mixing bowl. Let sit 5 min.
Add room temp water, flour, salt. Mix on low to incorporate all (~1 min).
Once incorporated, increase speed and mix med high 5 min, then let rest 10 min.
Mix on med high 10-15min til dough pulls away from sides, and is smooth and elastic.
Use 1/4 c olive oil to oil a bowl. Place dough in bowl, making sure dough isn't stuck to bowl sides anywhere. Dab a bit of the oil from the side on the top. Cover and let rest til doubled (1-2 hrs)
Poke to see if springs back with a slight indent left. Oil the sheet pan.
Starting from the sides of the dough ball, lift dough up, give it a bit of a wiggle, then bring back down. Turn the bowl 90 degrees, repeat lift and fold, for a total of 4 times.
Place dough onto oiled tray and gently push and stretch dough to edges with fingers. If stretching back too much, let gluten rest.
Use plastic wrap with some leftover oil to cover the dough, and let gluten rest 10-15min. After the rest, stretch all the way to the corners. Dough should be about halfway up the edges.
Let rise 45-55min, or til dough reaches top of pan edges. Or, can let rise in fridge overnight-24hrs.
Day 2:
Mix toppings and let infuse a bit. Can also just use 1/4c olive oil for topping.

Dimpling: Oil hands (can use the pooled oil around dough). Claw hands and push fingers all the way down to the bottom of pan to make big dimples. This deflates some of the bubbles to prevent a huge dome bread.
Drizzle toppings on with spoon, if any. Top with some flaky salt on top.

Bake at 450F on very bottom rack (for crispy bottom!) 20-25min. Should have a golden top and pulling a bit from the sides. Then, move to top rack and bake for 5-10 more min (this will create more browning on top.)
Let cool 10 min in pan, then remove from pan onto cooling rack.

name: rye loaf bread
directions: Make preferment by mixing all ingredients til smooth. Ferment at room temp 10hrs or til visibly puffed up and bubbly.
Mix remaining water, yeast, syrup, salt. Add to preferment, then add seeds. Mix til well combined and smooth.
Add remaining flour and mix til smooth.
Tip dough onto well-floured surface. Gently shape into brick shape and coat in flour (careful not to fold raw flour into the brick).
Place dough in tin and ferment 2hr or til well puffed and cracked all over.
Ideal loaf temp is 77-78F/25-26C. If warmer, reduce proofing time; if cooler, increase proofing time.
Bake at 320F/160C for 50min or til center is 200F/94C.
Cool in tin 10 min, then cool completely on rack for 24 hrs.

name: buckwheat loaf bread
directions: Mix yeast, sugar, water. Let rest 10 min.
Beat egg + oil well until smooth and frothy.
Flour + salt in big bowl, well in the center. Add egg mix, vinegar, yeast mix.
Stir well til batter is thick and drops sluggishly off the spoon. May need 2 more tbsp water for right consistency,
Pour batter into lightly-greased or lined tin, equivalent to half of the volume of a 8.5 x 4.5 loaf tin.
Spread batter evenly in tin. Cover and let rise in warm place, 1-2 hours.
Bake at 190C/375F fan oven, 220C/430F for 18-22 min (25-30 min for reg loaf size).
Internal temp should be 190F. Let cool and then slice.

name: buckwheat roll
directions: Warm water + sugar + yeast. Let foam (10-15min).
Add oil, flours, salt. Knead.
Cover dough and rise til double.
Shape into loaf on floured surface. Let rest 30 more min.
Bake inside covered Dutch oven at 480F for 30min.

name: crusty bread rolls
directions: Makes 12 rolls.
Make starter by mixing starter ingredients together til smooth, covering, and letting rest room temp overnight.
Combine all dough ingredients + starter. Mix and knead til soft, somewhat smooth dough--cohesive but surface may be bit rough and dough may stick to bowl tiny bit.
Cover, let dough rise for 3 hours. (1 hr into rise, gently deflate it and turn it over, and let rest the remaining 2 hrs).
Divide dough into 12 pieces, shape into balls, place on parchment lined baking sheet. Cover and let rise 1-2 hrs (puffy but not doubled!--will flatten as rise, dont worry)
Cover and chill for 2-3 hrs. Don't worry if flat, they will puff in oven. Optional egg wash of frothy whisked egg white + water.
Slash 1/4" deep cut across tops. Immediately put into oven.
Bake at 425F 20-25min til deep golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool, or for better crunch, open oven door and let rolls cool in turned-off open-door oven.
(For larger rolls, divide the dough into 8 pieces, rather than 12. Bake for a minute or two longer.)

name: shokupan

items.name: water
items.note: originally milk, now combine with milk powder

directions: For a 9x4x4 pullman.
Tangzhong:
Combine tangzhong ingredients in unheated saucepan. Whisk over med low heat til thick paste.
Remove from heat and chill til cool to touch (~10min)
Dough:
In big bowl, mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt, milk powder if using.
Whisk egg and milk and add to dry. Also add tangzhong. Mix til dough forms a ball.
Add butter til fully incorporated, and dough smooth and elastic. Knead til windowpane test.
Let rise 1-1.5 hr til doubled.
Punch down to remove gas. Divide into three pieces and quickly roll into smooth balls.
Flatten, roll up, flatten again, and roll up again. Place balls in buttered pan, side by side. Let rise again ~30-40min til dough almost at top of pan
Carefully slide on lid. Bake at 350F for 35min. 200-210F internal temp.

name: bagels
directions: Stir dry ingredients together. Add wet ingredients and knead in mixer for 10 min.
Rest dough covered for 20 min~1 hour, til dough looks a lot smoother than before.
Divide into pieces (~140g each)
Roll into snakes on unfloured counter, wrap around hand, roll firmly against counter to seal.
Place rings on parchment paper squares.
Rest covered at room temp ~ 1hr, then transfer to fridge to rest overnight.
16~24 hrs later, get oven as hot as possible. Take bagels out of fridge.
Boil bagels in syrup water, at a gentle rolling boil. 10-15 seconds on each side.
Bake for 5-10 min and rest cool for 15 min on racks.
Baker's percentages:
100% high gluten flour
50% water
0.5% yeast
2.5% salt
3% oil
5% sugar
0.25% diastatic malt

name: cinnamon raisin bagels

items.name: barley malt powder
items.note: should be non-diastatic. can also use 10g malt syrup instead

items.name: barley malt powder
items.note: should be non-diastatic. can also use 1T malt syrup instead. for water bath

directions: Makes 6 bagels.
Day 1:
Mix yeast, water, and 4g sugar. Let sit and get foamy.
Add flour, rest og sugar, and malt powder/syrup.
Knead on med-low speed 7 min. Then at low speed, slowly add salt.
Once combined, increase speed to med-low and knead 3-5 more min til dough very smooth and passes windowpane test.
Mix cinnamon with 5 tsp water to make a paste.
Add cinnamon paste and knead til dough looks marbled. Add raisins and knead til fully incorporated (this step may be easier by hand).
Divide dough into 6 balls.
Roll each ball into a 9-inch rope. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest 15 min.
Attach ends of each rope to form rings. Careful not to deflate the dough, but ok to gently pinch the ends together and gently rub the dough against work surface where dough was joined.
Place each ring on parchment square. Tightly over baking sheet with wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Day 2:
Let dough come to room temp 1.5-2 hours.
30 min before baking, preheat over to 425F.
Bring water (~2.25qt of water) + malt syrup to a gentle boil.
Drop bagel with parchment paper into water. Let each bagel boil for 30 sec on each side.
Bake bagels for 16-20 min at 425F. Cool completely.
If freezing, slice beforehand. To defrost, wrap each bagel in foil, place in cold oven, and turn oven onto 350F. Bagels will be ready within a few min of oven reaching 350F.

name: mehrkornbrot

items.name: bread flour
items.note: wholemeal flour of any kind (wheat, spelt, rye, or mixed)

items.name: pumpkin seed
items.note: any seeds of choice (sesame, pumpkin, sunflower, mixed) total 150g

directions: Multigrain bread
Mix and knead all. Pour into loaf tin, and let rest 30 min.
Bake at 356F/180C for 1hr.

name: vollkornbrot
directions: https://www.kingarthurbaking.com/recipes/vollkornbrot-recipe
https://www.daringgourmet.com/vollkornbrot-german-whole-grain-seed-bread/

name: idli

items.name: poha
items.note: thick poha. makes soft and fluffy idli, but optional

items.name: ground fenugreek seeds
items.note: this is incorrect!!! this should be whole fenugreek seeds 1/4t!!!

directions: Rinse rice a couple times
Rinse poha once or twice.
Add poha + 2c water to rice. Mix very well. Cover and soak 4-5 hrs.
Combine urad dal + fenugreek, rinse a couple times. Add 1 c water. Cover and soak 4-5 hrs.
Grid urad dal and 1/4c of reserved water (fresh water fine...) for few seconds. Add another 1/4c of water and grind until light and fluffy.
Drain rice + poha. Grind with reserved urad water or fresh water, up to 3/4 c of water (depends on rice, but batter shouldn't be too thick or thin)
Combine the two batters and mix very well. If weather is warm, add salt now (cold temp will prevent fermentation!)
Cover loosely (not air tight) and keep in warm place 8-9 hrs, 12-24hrs for cold places.
Gently brush molds with oil. Steam over a light boil, covered, for 12-15 min.

name: chai latte
directions: Toast spices on med low for 5 min. Stir occasionally and don't let them burn! Cool down and crush.
Bring 1 cup of water, spices, sugar, 3 tea bags, and ginger to a boil. Simmer for 10 min on med low heat.
Add milk to pot. Let come to a boil again and serve.

name: sikhye
directions: Mix barley malt powder with 14 cups cold water in large bowl. Stir well with whisk or wooden spoon.
Let sit 2-3 hours until powder settles on the bottom.
Make cooked rice with the 1c of raw rice. Fluff up the rice a bit in the cookier.
Add the clear malt water (top level) from the bowl by gently pouring into rice cooker where the rice is. Be careful not to get any of the sludge in.
Stir the rice with a wooden spoon and break it up a bit.
Set the rice cooker to the Keep Warm setting. Let sit and ferment for 4 hours.
Stir the rest of the 4 cups of water into the leftover barley malt sediment. Let sit while rice ferments.
Open rice cooker after 4 hours and check if some of the rice grains are floating. If not many are floating yet, let ferment another hour.
When ready, pour hot sikhye out of rice cooker into a large pot.
Gently pour in the clear malt (top level) from the bowl. You should get about 3 more cups of the malty water.
Discard the malt sediment.
Cover the pot and bring to a boil for 10 min. Add sugar if desired and mix well.
Can serve hot now! Or, pour hot sikhye through strainer over a large bowl.
Rinse the rice under cold water and transfer into airtight container with some cold water. Cover and refrigerate.
Cool the hot sikhye. Transfer to glass jar and refrigerate. When serving, ladle some sikhye, then gently stir in some rice.

name: no churn ice cream
directions: Whisk condensed milk, vanilla, salt.
Beat whipped cream til stiff peaks. Gently fold cream into condensed milk.
Cover and freeze 4+hrs.

name: ice cream sandwiches
directions: Line 9x13 pan with paper going up the two short sides. Grease the long exposed sides.
Melt butter in large bowl halfway, then whisk til fully melted (will help keep temp down)
Whisk in sugar, salt, milk. Whisk in egg white and vanilla thoroughly (make sure no clear bits left from egg!)
Add cocoa powder, baking powder, mix thoroughly. Add flour and stir til just incorporated.
Spread batter onto pan in a thin even layer. Bake at 325F for 15min, then cool in pan completely.
Whisk condensed milk, vanilla, salt.
Beat whipped cream til stiff peaks. Gently fold cream into condensed milk.
Run knife along sides to remove cookie from pan. Cut in half (to create two squarish pieces), place one half back on lined pan.
Spread ice cream smoothly on cookie. Press other cookie on top, using paper to keep shape.
Freeze 6hrs, ideally overnight. Cut into 8-12 rectangles. Stores for 3 months frozen.

name: bean ice cream sandwiches
directions: Process rolled oats until powder.
Add all ingredients into processor and blend til smooth.
Line baking sheet with paper. Use 1 spoon of dough per cookie, form into ball, and press down.
