Bake at 350F for 20-22 min. Cool completely.
For ice cream: process and freeze for 6+hrs.

name: bean ice cream sandwiches 2
directions: Blend all ingredients in food processor except flour. Transfer to bowl and add the flour, if using (optional).
Cover bowl and refrigerate at least 15 min, or until batter is solid enough to handle.
Line baking sheet with paper. Use 1 heaped tablespoon of dough per cookie, form into ball, and press down.
Bake at 325F for 10-12 min. Cool completely.

name: frozen yogurt
directions: Blend all ingredients and freeze.
For v2, remove after 2hrs in freezer and whip while still half-frozen for about 2 min. Repeat 3-4 times.

name: ice cream sandwiches 2
directions: Joy of baking ice cream sandwiches
Line 10x15 pan with foil and lightly butter the foil.
Whisk melted butter and sugar in large bowl. Whisk in egg and vanilla.
Sift in flour and cocoa powder. Add salt. Stir all til combined and smooth.
Spread batter onto pan in a thin even layer. Bake at 350F/180C for 8min (dry but soft and just pulling from edges), then cool on rack.
Whisk condensed milk, vanilla, salt.
Beat whipped cream til stiff peaks. Gently fold cream into condensed milk.
Remove cookie from pan. Cut in half (to create two squarish pieces), place one half back on lined pan.
Spread ice cream smoothly on cookie. Press other cookie on top, using paper to keep shape.
Freeze 2-4hrs, ideally overnight. Cut into 8 rectangles. Stores for 1 week frozen.

name: ice cream sandwiches 3
directions: Food wishes ice cream sandwiches
Whisk flour, salt, baking soda, and sifted cocoa powder.
In separate bowl, mix butter, sugars, vanilla til smooth paste. Add flour mix and milk. Stir til smooth and stiff batter.
Spoon 12 balls onto lined and greased baking pan.
Bake at 350F/175C center rack for 9-10min (til tops no longer wet and shiny). Tap and shake pan 5 times on counter to settle cookies.
Let cool on pan til room temp ~15min, then freeze til firm 15 min. Poke tops of cookies.
Whisk condensed milk, vanilla, salt.
Beat whipped cream til stiff peaks. Gently fold cream into condensed milk.
Place one scoop of ice cream in between each cookie pair.
Freeze for at least 3 hrs.

name: macaroons
directions: Mix coconut, milk, vanilla.
Beat egg whites and salt into stiff peaks. Gently fold egg whites into coconut mix.
Scoop ~2 tbsp at a time (makes 13) onto lined pan. Bake at 325F on center rack for 25 min or until golden brown.
Immediately remove from baking sheet to cool. Dip in chocolate and set for 1-2 hours once cool.
Stores at room temp 1 week or frozen (if no chocolate) 3 months

name: thick texas cookies
directions: Makes 6 huge cookies.
Add butter and sugars to bowl and cream until light and fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla and mix. Add dry ingredients and mix. It's okay that it's crumbly.
Add chocolate chips. GENTLY mold onto baking sheet and refrigerate for 30+min.
Bake for 18 minutes at 375F.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer them and let cool to room temperature. (Must be room temp when serving)

name: oatmeal raisin cookies
directions: Makes 9 cookies.
Beat butter til creamy. Add sugars, and beat til fluffy (2min)
Add egg in 2 batches, beat til fully incorporated. Beat in vanilla.
Mix flour, salt, baking soda, spices. Beat dry into wet. Stir in oats and raisins.
Ball into 9 cookies onto lined sheet, 2+ inches between each cookie. Chill for up to 24h.
Bake at 350F for 9-13 min. Cool on baking sheet for 5 min, then transfer carefully to cooling rack.

name: hong kong egg tart
directions: Makes 8 tarts.
For pastry:
Combine flour, salt, sugar. Add butter and break up roughly with fingers. Make sure butter chunks are visible in dough.
Add water and bring dough together. Cover dough and refrigerate for 20 min.
Knead dough into a rectangle on floured surface. Roll dough away from body (not back and forth) into a 8x20 inch rectangle. Don't overwork! Butter should still be visible.
Fold top third of dough down to center, then the bottom third up and over that. Give the dough a 90deg turn and roll out to 3x the length. Do the same folding.
Cover and chill for 30 min.
For custard:
Microwave water + sugar til dissolved.
Whisk egg, milk, vanilla. Mix water in little bits at a time. Strain.
425F for 15 min. If it starts bubbling up, crack open oven.

name: madeleines
directions: Makes 10 cookies. (Can make 9 big ones if you really wanted.)
Melt butter, then cool to room temp for 8 min.
During those 8 min, beat egg and sugar until thick, pale, and forms ribbons. Beat in zest and vanilla until combined.
Whisk flour, baking powder, salt in small bowl. Gently fold into egg mix. Tip: fold in half first, then the rest. Be careful and delicate!!
Stir 1/4c of batter into butter, will take about a min to incorporate. Stir that into the rest of the batter.
Chill for 30-60 min.
Generously grease up pan with melted butter. Spoon about 1 tbsp (~20-22g) batter into each scallop.
Bake at 350F for 10 min, maybe less.
To infuse butter with tea:
1c of butter makes 3/4c butter. (For madeleine recipe, will need 1/3c butter or ~75g)
2g (1.5tsp) tea leaves per 1tbsp of butter. (For 1/3c butter, will need to use 10.5g (8tsp) of tea
Small saucepan, melt butter til just liquid. Add tea. Continue heating for 5min on low heat.
Remove from heat and let sit 5 more min or til butter is tinted by tea.
Strain out tea leaves and squeeze them hard.

name: condensed milk madeleines
directions: Melt and bring butter to room temp.
Beat egg thoroughly.
Whisk dry ingredients. Add egg, gently combine. Add butter in 3 steps, stirring well after each.
Add milk and vanilla. Whisk well. Chill in fridge 2-24hr.
Butter and flour pan. Makes 16 madeleines. Fill pan to 80% full.
Bake at 356F for 10 min. Cool in pan 5 min, then cool on rack. Keeps 3 days room temp, 1 week fridge, 1 month frozen.

name: mochi madeleines
directions: Makes 6-7??
Melt butter, then cool to room temp for 8 min.
During those 8 min, beat egg, sugar, vanilla until thick, pale, and forms ribbons.
Whisk flours, baking powder, salt in small bowl. Gently fold into egg mix. Tip: fold in half first, then the rest. Be careful and delicate!!
Stir 1/4c of batter into butter, will take about a min to incorporate. Stir that into the rest of the batter.
Chill for 30-60 min.
Generously grease up pan with melted butter. Spoon about 1 tbsp (~20-30g) batter into each scallop.
Bake at 350F for 10 min, maybe less.

name: buckwheat madeleines
directions: Makes 12 cookies
Melt butter over med heat til color of maple syrup and smells toasty. Cool to room temp.
Whisk flours, sugar, baking powder, and salt in med bowl.
Stir in egg white and honey.
Stir in 1/3 of the browned butter. Then, add in rest of butter (including dark bits), without scraping bottom of pan.
Stir in cacao nibs.
Generously grease up pan with melted butter. Spoon about 1 tbsp batter into each scallop.
Bake at 400F for 9-10min, til springs back lightly when press in center. Let cool in pan for 30 sec, then transfer to rack.

name: apple pie
directions: Combine flour + salt. Add butter and cut in with knife.
When butter is the size of peas, use hands to squeeze dough for a few min.
When dough stays in a clump after you squeeze it, place in fridge for 10 min.
Add vinegar and 2 tbsp of water. Stir with fork til mixture comes together. Add more water as needed, but dont use more than 5 tbsp water total.
Shape dough into flat disk, wrap, and fridge for 30 min.
Toss apples in spices + sugar.
Roll out crust. Press down apples when adding to prevent air gaps.
Bake at 425F on lowest rack for 20 min. Lower temp to 350F and bake on middle rack for 15-20 min til filling is bubbling. Cool for 2 hours.

name: pumpkin pie
directions: Make crust. Wrap smooth disc in fridge for 2hrs+, overnight good too.
Mix sugar, spices, and salt. Add egg and mix well. Add milk and mix well.
Add pumpkin and mix til smooth and completely combined.
Pour onto unbaked pie crust.
Bake 425F for 15min, then 350F for 30min. Cool for 2hrs
Store in fridge for 3-4 days. To freeze, cool completely; freezes for up to 1 month. Thaw in fridge overnight to eat.

name: tiny pumpkin pie
directions: Day 1:
For crust:
Combine flour, salt, sugar. (Food processor: pulse til well combined)
Add the butter, half at a time. (Pulse 8 times, add, then pulse 6 times)
Slowly add ice water + vinegar mix. (Pulse several times each time you add.)
Should be crumbly dough that holds together when you squish it.
Form dough into a disk, wrap and chill in fridge for at least 30min-1 hour. Work dough just enough to bring together, too much will make it tough.
Remove from fridge and let sit for 10-15 min. Roll out once soft to ~8inch circle.
Place in foil-lined 6" cake pan. Freeze til ready to cook.
Day 2:
To blindbake crust:
Bake at 425F for 12-15min (closer to 15) with pie weights, til edges golden. Remove pie weights, let bake til bottom of crust looks dry, about 5-10min.
Brush bottom with egg wash, bake for 3 more min.
Let crust cool.
Mix sugar, spices, and salt. Add egg and mix well. Add milk and mix well.
Add pumpkin and mix til smooth and completely combined.
Bake at 350F for 40-45min (closer to 45 min) til light wobble in center (internal temp 160-170F). Cool for 2 hrs and enjoy.
Stores in fridge 3 days, freezes well 1 month (thaw overnight in fridge!)

name: bean pie
directions: Make crust.
Cream sugar, butter, and eggs. Add rest of ingredients. Blend til thick and smooth.
Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350F 1 hour or til knife comes out clean.

name: cardamom cake

items.name: ground cardamom
items.note: or 4g of the black seeds bruised gently

directions: Butter and sugar 6-inch round pan, tapping and shaking. Line bottom of pan before coating for extra layer of safety.
Leave any extra sugar on bottom. Cover bottom with crunchy topping choice (sliced almonds/pepitas/breadcrumbs/pearl sugar/etc)
Melt butter in little saucepan. Toss in bruised cardamom seeds and let seep.
In stand mixer, cream eggs and sugar til thick, pale, tripled in volume (8min).
Quickly fold in flour and salt into egg mix. Some streaks ok.
Mix a bit of batter in butter, then fold butter into rest of batter. Pour batter into pan, bang a few times to remove bubbles.
Bake at 350F 35 min (til top is dry and springy, center comes out dry). Cool in pan for 5 min. Run knife along sides, then invert onto rack to cool completely.
Store wrapped tight in fridge 1 week, or 3 days room temp.

name: carrot cake
directions: A very thick 6-inch cake. Maybe 10-12 cupcakes
Grate (maybe 4 medium) carrots.
Mix flour, baking soda, salt, spices.
Whisk oil, sugars, vanilla. Whisk egg one at a time.
Combine dry and wet. Add carrots and nuts.
Bake at 350F 30-40 min. Cool in pan for 15 min, then cool on rack. (If cupcake, bake for 14-18 min)
Frosting: whisk cream cheese and butter til smooth. Mix sugar, vanilla, and salt til smooth.

name: yogurt carrot cake
directions: A very thick 6-inch cake or 12 cupcakes
Grate (maybe 4 medium) carrots.
Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, spices.
Whisk sugars, oil, vanilla til well mixed. Mix on med-high/high speed for 4 min.
Stir and fold in half of the dry mix. Stir and fold in half of the carrots.
Stir and fold in the rest of the dry mix, then stir and fold in the rest of the carrots.
Pour into greased, floured, and bottom-lined 6-inch pan.
Bake at 350F 50-60 min (til toothpick comes out with only a few moist crumbs). Cool in pan for 15 min, then cool inverted on rack.
Cool completely before frosting. Chill frosted cake 1 hr before serving. Cake can store 1 day in fridge, frosted or unfrosted. Unfrosted cake freezes for 3 months (thaw in fridge overnight).
If making cupcakes, bake for 15-20 min.
Frosting:
Strain yogurt in colander lined with coffee filter or paper towel, on top of a small bowl, in fridge for a few hours.
Discard whey, whisk strained yogurt with sugar and vanilla. Frosting good for 2 days in fridge.

name: chocolate hummus
directions: Blend in food processor.

name: chocolate chili cookies
directions: In small bowl, whisk flour, cocoa, salt, ginger, cinnamon, clove, and chili.
In another small bowl, stir baking soda into warm water until dissolved. Set aside.
In large bowl, beat butter and sugar until smooth and creamy, ~1-2 min.
Beat in honey and vanilla until smooth.
Gradually add half of flour mix. Add baking soda mix, then remaining flour. Stir in choc chips.
Chill until firm, ~30 min. Make 4 cookie balls, roll each in sugar.
Bake 13-15 min at 325F. Will be soft, cool on baking sheet for 5 min.

name: chocolate babka

items.name: chocolate chips
items.note: up to 60g if you're feeling luxurious

directions: In medium bowl, heat up milk + vanilla + nutmeg. Add yeast to milk and let bubble. Whisk in egg.
In large bowl, mix flour, sugar, salt til combined.
Add wet mix to dry. Mix til dough comes together. Use fork, will be sticky.
Add butter gradually, mix til incorporated.
Keep using fork, will be sticky for a whie. Mix til dough is completely smooth, elastic, shiny, pulls away from sides.
Dough in greased cover bowl. Rest for half a day or overnight.
Grease 9x4 in loaf pan. Line bottom with parchment paper.
Make filling by whisking everything into a paste.
Roll out dough into rect (15x11?), long side closest to you. Spread filling, sprinkle choc chips on top.
Shape dough: Roll tight. Fridge/freezer for 10 min to set, cut in half lengthwise, braid from center.
Put dough in loaf pan or 2 mini loaf pans. Cover loosely, rise for 1-1.5 hr. Optionally, rise overnight, then take out to get to room temp for an hour before baking.
Bake 40-50 min 350F. 45 min is definitely good. Experiment. (35min for half loaf pans)
Brush with sugar syrup IMMEDIATELY after out of oven.
Cool til warm, remove from pans, cool completely before serving.

name: cinnamon rolls
directions: Make tangzhong: whisk all ingredients in small saucepan til no lumps.
Cook on med heat, whisking constantly, til thick (~1 min). Set aside.
Mix tangzhong with all dough ingredients. Mix til all together, set aside 20 min.
Knead til a smooth, elastic, sticky dough.
Shape dough into ball. Let rest covered 60-90min til puffy but not quite double.
Mix sugar and cinnamon well.
Punch down dough. Roll into 18"x8" rectangle. Sprinkle filling on top.
Roll into log, starting with long edge. Cut into 12 slices (~1.5" thick each).
Place into lightly greased 9x9 pan. Cover and let rise 45-60 min (til crowded and puffy).
Bake 350F, bottom third rack, 25-30min. Will be barely browned, should be 188F interior temp.
Spread icing (should be about as thick as softened cream cheese) onto hot rolls.
Can store cooled rolls room temp a few days.

name: sliced sweet potato pie

items.name: sweet potato
items.note: about 2 lb. use american sweet potato :)

directions: Pair with 1 9-inch pie crust.
Peel and slice sweet potatoes (1/4 in thick). Boil on high heat til tender
Mix sugar, flour, salt, spices together. Toss sweet potatoes in spices.
Place sweet potatoes in crust. Dot butter on top of sweet potatoes.
Bake 350F for 1hr. Let cool completely.

name: milk mantou
directions: In a big bowl, pour milk. Sprinkle yeast on top. Add sugar. Stir.
Add flour to milk, then oil. Use spatula to stir into a shaggy stiff dough.
Start kneading with hands til smooth (~10 min vigorous or ~15min slower kneading).
Roll into log, and slice off ~50g pieces (5 total?).

For each piece, remove bubbles. Press with body weight and roll into a long log, bring the two ends into the center to ball back up, then press and roll into log again 3 times. At the end of the process, dough will be very stiff. Press and close up into a tight smooth ball.

Prepare steamer. Add 3cm of water to a pot, heat it up to 45C (warm if you stick your hands in, but not hot). Turn off the heat, place steamer with buns on top to rise for ~1hr (1.5x size, or gently bounces back).
Steam on med heat for 18 min with lid cracked open. After steaming, turn off heat and let sit max 5 min before removing lid.

name: new steamed custard buns

items.name: egg yolk
items.note: or also just 1 more whole egg

directions: Makes 12 buns.
Custard steps:
Mix whisked egg, butter, milk. In separate big bowl, mix cake flour, sugar, milk powder.
Mix wet into dry. Sieve to remove lumps.
Heat over low heat and stir constantly for 12-15min or til thick paste that lifts from the bottom of pan (be patient! even after 6 min will be not noticeable). Cover and chill overnight.
The next day, divide and shape into 12 balls (each ~30g). Cover and place back in fridge.
Dough steps:
In medium bowl, mix milk, sugar, and yeast.
In large mixing bowl, mix flour, milk powder. Add in yeast milk mix and stir.
Knead on med-low speed for a few min until one cohesive rough piece.
Add soft butter in 3 batches and knead until absorbed. Knead for 8 more min.
Shape into a round, smooth ball. Cover and let rise 1-1.5 hr or til doubled.
Punch dough for 1 min to remove all air. Knead for 6-8 min on flat surface.
Divide into 12 pieces (~50g each), shape each into smooth, tight ball by rolling and folding. Cover and let rest 10 min.

For each ball, dust lightly with flour to prevent stickiness. Roll flat to about 5-inch diameter (first roll flat to 4-inch diameter, then work around the edges to make thinner). Press in the filling compactly into the center, lightly wet edges, and pinch and close.
Let buns proof for 20 min in steamer that's been filled with room temp water.
After 20 min, turn heat on steamer to high. Once steam starts to come up, turn heat to med-low and let steam for 8-10 min. Then, turn off heat and let sit for at least 3 min.
Freeze after steamed for 3 months. Re-steam for 15 min from frozen.

name: steamed custard buns

items.name: water
items.note: room temp; to sub cold milk

directions: Makes 3 buns.
Mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt, oil. Add room temp water. Mix til rough dough.
Cover, let rest 15min. Then, knead til smooth, silky, elastic. If hard to knead, just let rest.
Do one more 15min gluten rest before shaping (do NOT let rise).
Divide dough into smaller pieces. Fill. Roll into very smooth tall balls (smooth top with milk/water if desired).

Place each ball on parchment paper. Let rise only once, to 50% larger (don't let double in size!) Done proving when poking dough leaves indent that bounces back slowly (not enough if bounce back fast). (very roughly 30min room temp)
Bring steamer water to boil, lower the heat to MEDIUM. Place buns 1 inch apart, close lid and crack open about a 1/4 inch gap.
Steam 18 min (15 min if no filling)
After steaming, turn off heat. Do NOT open lid, and let sit for 5 min.
Good filling is 1 small sweet potato (175g raw) steamed and mashed, or 200g red bean,...
Custard steps:
Mix egg + sugar + cornstarch/flour well.
Put pot with butter + milk on low/med heat, heat up til just melted.
Pour milk into egg. Pour all into pot. Heat over low heat, stir frequently, and take off just when thickened.
Freeze for 20 min. Shape, then freeze for 3+hr.
To freeze, let cool completely then freeze. Reheat straight from frozen in steamer on medium heat lid cracked open for 17 min, then let sit in steamer 5 min.

name: liu sha bao
directions: Makes 3-4 buns.
Steam yolks for 5 min.
Mash yolk with knife. Mix very well to smooth paste. Chill in fridge (not freezer!) 30min-1hr. Divide filling (~15-17g each).
Note: removed 2g of custard powder/cornstarch from custard recipe.
Dissolve yeast + sugar in water. Add in dry ingredients. Mix til dough.
Knead til smooth dough. Divide into parts (~35g each). For each piece, knead for about 10 sec, then let rest.
For each piece, roll out, fold, roll out, fold, and roll out again. Flatten into wrapper (9cm diameter) with rolling pin.
Let relax 5 min. Place spoonful of filling into wrapper and seal. Let rest 10-15 min. (15min max)
Bring water to full boil. Place buns in steamer with cracked open lid, and cook over med heat 10 min. Serve immediately.

name: steamed sausage buns
directions: Makes 6 buns.
Cook sausages in simmering water for 12 min til fat rises to top. Cool and cut into 2 pieces each.
Dissolve yeast + sugar in water. Add in dry ingredients. Mix til dough.
Knead til smooth dough. Divide into parts (~35g each). For each piece, knead for about 10 sec, then let rest.
For each piece, roll out, fold, roll out, fold, and roll out again. Flatten into wrapper (9cm diameter) with rolling pin.
Let relax 5 min. Wrap each sausage. Let rest 10-15 min. (15min max)
Bring water to full boil. Place buns in steamer with cracked open lid, and cook over med heat 10 min. Serve immediately.

name: steamed cake
directions: Line just bottom of 6-inch round pan or use 6-inch springform.
Start prepping steamer to get to a gentle rolling boil. Start boiling when you start beating eggs.
Whisk cake flour + salt.
Mix sugar + eggs in stand mixer with paddle attachment or hand mixer high speed (8 on stand mixer).
Beat til very thick, pale, creamy (~8 min). Check for ribbon stage.
Add extract and mix on low speeed. Gradually add flour while mixing, ideally in under a minute.
Stop mixer and use spatula to scrape sides and very gently fold any loose flour. Water must be a rolling boil at this point.
Pour batter into pan. Pop any large bubbles.
Lower steamer heat to med. Put pan inside steamer. Close lid, leaving 1/2 inch gap.
Steam over med heat for 45-50 min. Wait 5 min before removing from steamer.
Let cake cool, then remove from pan.

name: steamed condensed milk cake version 2
directions: Line 6-inch round pan on the bottom.
Whisk egg yolks and condensed milk. Mix in butter and vanilla.
Sift in flour, cornstarch, baking powder. Add salt. Mix in dry til just combined.
Whisk egg whites with sugar and make meringue til medium stiff peaks.
Add meringue into batter in 3 batches. Fold gently. Pour batter into pan.
Steam over med heat for 45 min, with cloth on lid or lid slightly cracked open. Let rest in steamer with heat turned off for 5 min, then remove from steamer.
Let cake cool lightly, then remove from pan.

name: condensed milk cake
directions: Line 6-inch round pan on the bottom.
Whisk dry. Whisk wet + zest. Sift dry into wet, mix til combined.
Pour batter into pan.
Bake at 320F for 30-40 min, til golden and tester clean.
Keeps for 3 days room temp, 2 months frozen.

name: basic chiffon cake
directions: Sift flour, cornstarch, baking powder.
Beat yolk + sugar til light and fluffy 2-3 min electric mixer. Mix in salt, oil, water, extracts.
Make well in dry, add and mix in yolk well.
Beat egg whites til frothy. Add vinegar and meringue sugar. Beat til stiff peaks.
Fold whites into batter. Pour all into lined 6-in round pan.
Bake at 325F for 45 min.
Immediately remove cake from pan. Peel paper and cool.

name: olive oil chiffon sheet cake
directions: Line just the bottom of a half sheet pan (13x18 inch).
In med bowl, mix cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt.
Mix olive oil, buttermilk, vanilla into easy pour cup.
In large bowl, beat yolk + yolk sugar for 1 min til thick and pale. Stream in liquids slowly into yolk while mixing.
Add dry mix and whisk til mixed and smooth.
Beat room temp egg whites, cream of tartar, salt on med low til foamy. Slowly stream in sugar and beat on med high til stiff glossy peaks.
Fold whites into yolk in three batches til streak free.
Pour evenly onto sheet pan. Tap once to remove air bubbles.
Bake at 350F 18-20 min til puffed, golden, and springy. Cool completely.

name: chiffon cupcakes
directions: Whisk yolk, milk, oil well. Sift in flour and mix well.
Beat egg whites + lemon juice til frothy. Add sugar in 3 steps, beating til stiff peaks.
Gently fold a bit of the whites into batter, then back into the rest of the whites.
Pour into lined cupcakes, 80% of the way up. Should make 10 total.
Bake at 305F for 50 min.
Cool completely on rack, with paper on. Lasts in fridge 2 days?

name: tapioca chiffon cupcakes
directions: Whisk yolk + melted cooled butter, then mix in milk + vanilla.
Sift in flours and whisk.
Make meringue with egg white + sugar (sugar in 2 batches) til stiff peaks.
Fold 1/3 of meringue into batter, then fold rest of batter back into meringue.
Preheat oven to 392F/200C, then bring down to 356F/180C.
Bake in 3 LINED muffin tins (batter goes up to about 2/3 of the liner) at 356F/180C for 20 min.

name: genoise cake

items.name: flour
items.note: combine with cornstarch to sub cake flour 55g

items.name: cornstarch
items.note: combine with flour to sub cake flour 55g

directions: Cake (2 layer 6-inch cake):
Over a pot with hot water, whisk egg, sugar, vanilla til 104F/40C in a very large stainless steel bowl.
Gently melt butter and milk in a medium bowl, over the pot also.
Beat the egg mix well until thick, fluffy, and ribbon stage (~10min on high speed).
Sift in half the flour, mix gently. Fold in using a figure-8 motion. Dig into bottom of bowl to prevent clumps. Gently sift and fold in rest of flour, and repeat.
Mix a bit of batter into butter and milk mix, then pour that back into batter.
Fold gently. Pour into buttered and lined 6-inch pan, pouring close to pan to prevent bubble loss.
Bake at 338F/170C for 37 min. Let cool, then cut into 2 layers.
Infused cream:
1 cup of cream infuses well with 2-3 tea bags or 2-3 tsp loose leaf tea
If infusing with tea, place pot with cream and tea in pot low heat until cream is scalded (reaches 180F). Take off heat, cover, and steep 5 min. Strain and chill til needed.

name: sweet potato cake

items.name: flour
items.note: combine with cornstarch to sub cake flour

items.name: cornstarch
items.note: combine with flour to sub cake flour

directions: Cake (18 cm genoise):
Melt butter, milk, vanilla gently (ideally over hot water bath)
Separate egg white + yolk.
Add sugar to yolk. Mix well, til pale ribbons.
Whip egg whites + sugar (add sugar in 3 batches) til soft peaks.
Carefully fold meringue into yolk mix, gradually.
Sift in flour. Fold gently.
Gently mix butter mix into batter. (Either add bit of batter into butter, mix, then combine with rest of batter; or pour butter carefully around edge of batter and fold inwards carefully)
Filling:
Boil sweet potatoes til soft. Peel and mash while hot.
Add sugar, mix well. Add cream, mix well.
Frosting:
Important to start with cold cream! Can even chill the bowl if you want.
In a large bowl, whip the whipping cream. When thicker, add powdered sugar. Whip til medium peaks.
Sugar syrup:
Microwave water + sugar. Doesn't have to be exactly this amount.
Assembly:
Make genoise crumbs from leftover cake
Place Genoise slice, brush with syrup, spread filling, repeat.
Ice entire cake with frosting and cover with genoise crumbs.

name: strawberry cake

items.name: flour
items.note: combine with cornstarch to sub cake flour 110g

items.name: cornstarch
items.note: combine with flour to sub cake flour 110g

directions: Cake (3 layer 6-inch cake):
Over a pot with hot water, whisk egg, sugar, vanilla til 104F/40C.
Gently melt butter and milk over the pot also.
Beat the egg mix well until thick, fluffy, and ribbon stage (10min?).
Sift in half the flour, mix gently. Fold in using a figure-8 motion. Dig into bottom of bowl to prevent clumps. Gently sift and fold in rest of flour, and repeat.
Mix a bit of batter into butter and milk mix, then pour that back into batter.
Fold gently. Pour into buttered and lined 6-inch pan, pouring close to pan to prevent bubble loss.
Bake at 338F/170C for 37 min. Let cool, then cut into 3 layers.
Assembly:
Cut strawberries into even thickness slices, brush with glaze (can use strawberry jam microwaved and thinned out with a bit of water). Also brush topping strawberries with same glaze.
For each Genoise slice: brush with milk, spread a bit of cream, place strawberries, another bit of cream, one more layer of strawberries, then top with more cream.
Keeps in fridge 3-4 days.

name: corn cream cake

items.name: flour
items.note: combine with cornstarch to sub cake flour 55g

items.name: cornstarch
items.note: combine with flour to sub cake flour 55g

directions: Cake (2 layer 6-inch cake):
Over a pot with hot water, whisk egg, sugar, vanilla til 104F/40C in a very large stainless steel bowl.
Gently melt butter and milk in a medium bowl, over the pot also.
Beat the egg mix well until thick, fluffy, and ribbon stage (~10min on high speed).
Sift in half the flour, mix gently. Fold in using a figure-8 motion. Dig into bottom of bowl to prevent clumps. Gently sift and fold in rest of flour, and repeat.
Mix a bit of batter into butter and milk mix, then pour that back into batter.
Fold gently. Pour into buttered and lined 6-inch pan, pouring close to pan to prevent bubble loss.
Bake at 338F/170C for 37 min. Let cool, then cut into 2 layers. Can make cake the day before and let rest at room temperature.
Corn custard:
Blend corn, milk, salt til smooth.
Whisk egg yolk, vanilla, sugar. Sift in cornstarch and mix well for 1 min.
Heat corn milk up until boiling lightly (about 176F/80C). Drizzle into egg mix while whisking.
Strain and pour back into pot. Heat while whisking until thickened.
Turn off heat, and mix in butter. Cling wrap and chill.
Whipped cream:
Whip cream and sugar til stiff peaks. Fold in about half of the corn custard.
Cake tastes best after being refrigerated for a day.

name: huge tres leches cake
directions: For a 13x9 pan. Halve for 8x8 cake. Line and grease only the bottom of pan.
Whisk flour, salt, baking powder, cinnamon.
Whip cold cream and vanilla for sponge in large bowl til medium peaks not too stiff (start at low speed to reduce splatter). Keep in fridge til use.
Whip eggs and sugar til tripled in volume and mousse like (7min).
Sift in dry ingredients in 3 parts. Mix on lowest speed, very quickly just to incorporate each time.
Fold in the whipped cream into the batter til no streaks.
Pour into pan. Bake 350F 28-35min (rotating pan after 20 min) til top risen. Little cracks ok! Let cool upside down above rack to preserve volume.
To make soak, mix all ingredients together,
Without removing cake from pan, poke holes all over cake. Pour soak all over. Pooling on top is expected. Let sit in fridge covered at least 3 hours.
Whip the heavy cream for frosting til very soft droopy peaks.
Invert cake to remove from pan. Cover the top with the whipped cream.
Frosted cake will keep in fridge covered for 3 days.

name: tres leches cake
directions: Halved for 8x8 cake. Line and grease only the bottom of pan.
Whisk flour, salt, baking powder, cinnamon.
Whip cold cream and vanilla for sponge in large bowl til medium peaks not too stiff (start at low speed to reduce splatter). Keep in fridge til use.
Whip eggs and sugar til tripled in volume and mousse like (7min).
Sift in dry ingredients in 3 parts. Mix on lowest speed, very quickly just to incorporate each time.
Fold in the whipped cream into the batter til no streaks.
Pour into pan. Bake 350F 28-35min (rotating pan after 20 min) til top risen. Little cracks ok! Let cool upside down above rack to preserve volume.
To make soak, mix all ingredients together,
Without removing cake from pan, poke holes all over cake. Pour soak all over. Pooling on top is expected. Let sit in fridge covered at least 3 hours.
Whip the heavy cream for frosting til very soft droopy peaks.
Invert cake to remove from pan. Cover the top with the whipped cream.
Frosted cake will keep in fridge covered for 3 days.

name: saffron milk cake
directions: To make soak, bring all ingredients to a boil, then simmer stirring on med low heat for 30 min. Let cool.
In medium bowl, whisk flour and baking powder.
Let saffron bloom in hot water.
Beat butter and sugar til pale and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla and extract til well combined.
Fold in dry and mix til just combined.
Pour into lined pan (1/3 the volume of an 8x8 pan. The little 10cm square pan works!) and smooth top.
Bake at 340F for 30 min, or til toothpick clean. Let cool.
Poke holes over cake and pour half the soak. Rest of the soak will be used when serving.
Whip heavy cream and top the cake. Let sit in fridge 4 hours - overnight.

name: swiss roll cake
directions: Mix yolk and yolk sugar. Whisk til dissolved and pale. Drizzle in oil, whisk constantly, til incorporated.
Whisk in milk, extract, salt. Add color as desired.
Sift in cake flour. Fold til incorporated.
Beat egg whites til frothy. Add egg white sugar. Beat on high speed til med-stiff peaks. Gently incorporate and fold into yolk batter.
Pour batter into lined 15x10 jelly roll pan (over frozen pattern, if any). Half sheet pan also works. Bang pan a few times to remove air bubbles.
Bake at 375F for 14-15 min or top springy and edges barely brown.
Remove from oven, flip onto a new sheet of parchment. Peel off baked parchment paper to reveal design.
Place cake (design side down) on tea towel dusted with powdered sugar. Starting with the side without the design, roll carefully in towel. Roll up along the long side!
Cool cake completely. Lightly unroll cake, remove towel, and spread a thin layer of filling. Leave about 1/2inch without filling at the far end.
Gently roll back up. Don't use too much pressure! Wrap tight in plastic wrap, refrigerate 2hr-overnight. Keeps in fridge tightly wrapped up to 3 days.

name: cinnamon swiss roll cake
directions: Frosting:
Strain yogurt in colander lined with coffee filter or paper towel, on top of a small bowl, in fridge for a few hours.
Discard whey, whisk strained yogurt with sugar and vanilla. Frosting good for 2 days in fridge.
Beat egg whites on med speed til soft peaks (1min). Slowly add sugar on high speed. Beat til thick and glossy (2-3min). Set aside.
In separate bowl, beat yolks, sugar, and vanilla on high speed 5 min til thick and pale. Add milk, oil, whisk til incorporated.
Sift flour, cinnamon, baking powder. Mix with salt.
Sift dry ingredients over yolk mix. Beat til smooth and no lumps.
Fold egg whites into batter in three batches til uniform.
Pour batter into lined 10x15 pan and spread flat gently.
Bake at 350F for 10-12 min til top of cake just gently springs back.
Remove from oven. Place cake on tea towel dusted with powdered sugar. Roll carefully starting from the narrow end.
Cool cake completely. Lightly unroll cake, remove towel, and spread a thin layer of cinnamon spread. Leave about 1 inch without filling at the far end. Spread yogurt spread on top.
Gently roll back up. Don't use too much pressure! Wrap tight in plastic wrap, refrigerate 2hr-overnight. Keeps in fridge tightly wrapped up to 3 days.

name: chocolate swiss roll cake 1
directions: Sift flour, cocoa powder, baking powder. Mix with salt and coffee powder. Set aside.
Beat egg whites on med speed til soft peaks (1min). Slowly add the 70g of sugar (1T at a time) on high speed. Beat til thick and glossy (2-3min). Set aside.
In separate bowl, beat yolks, 70g sugar, and vanilla on high speed 5 min til thick and pale.
Add half the egg white mix and gently fold til almost completely combined. Repeat with other half of egg whites til mixture is uniform.
Sift dry ingredients over egg mix. Gently fold through til well combined. Drizzle butter in and fold through til no streaks of butter.
Pour batter into lined 13x18 pan and spread flat gently.
Bake at 350F for 10 min (potentially 14min?) til top of cake just gently springs back.
Remove from oven. Place cake on tea towel dusted with 2T sieved cocoa powder. Roll carefully starting from the narrow end.
Cool cake completely. Lightly unroll cake, remove towel, and spread a thin layer of filling. Leave about 1 inch without filling at the far end.
Gently roll back up. Don't use too much pressure! Wrap tight in plastic wrap, refrigerate 2hr-overnight. Keeps in fridge tightly wrapped up to 3 days.

name: mini swiss roll cake

items.name: flour
items.note: for cake flour. if making chocolate try replacing 6-7g with equal amount cocoa

ingredients.category: bean filling. 2 mashed sweet potato also works

items.name: dried pinto bean
items.note: to sub 200g canned beans from 15oz can

directions: Mix yolk and yolk sugar. Whisk til dissolved and pale. Drizzle in oil, whisk constantly, til incorporated.
Whisk in milk, extract, salt. Add color as desired.
Sift in cake flour. Fold til incorporated.
Beat egg whites til frothy. Add egg white sugar. Beat on high speed til med-stiff peaks. Gently incorporate and fold into yolk batter.
Pour batter into lined quarter sheet pan. Bang pan a few times to remove air bubbles.
Bake at 375F for 14 min or top springy and edges barely brown.
Remove from oven, flip onto cooling rack, peel off baked parchment paper on top, then flip back (so browned side is back on top).
Roll carefully up along the long side while still hot. Cool cake completely, lightly unroll, and spread a thin layer of filling.
Gently roll back up. Don't use too much pressure! Wrap tight in plastic wrap, refrigerate 2hr-overnight. Keeps in fridge tightly wrapped up to 3 days.

name: banana roll cake

items.name: flour
items.note: for cake flour. if making chocolate try replacing 6-7g with equal amount cocoa

directions: For banana filling:
Mash banana. Mix in all other filling ingredients except vanilla.
Strain mixture into a pot. Cook on low heat til thickened. Add vanilla. Chill in fridge.
For cake:
Mix yolk and yolk sugar. Whisk til dissolved and pale. Drizzle in oil, whisk constantly, til incorporated.
Whisk in milk, extract, salt. Add color as desired.
Sift in cake flour. Fold til incorporated.
Beat egg whites til frothy. Add egg white sugar. Beat on high speed til med-stiff peaks. Gently incorporate and fold into yolk batter.
Pour batter into lined quarter sheet pan. Bang pan a few times to remove air bubbles.
Bake at 375F for 14 min or top springy and edges barely brown.
Remove from oven, flip onto cooling rack, peel off baked parchment paper on top, then flip back (so browned side is back on top).
Roll carefully up along the long side while still hot. Cool cake completely, lightly unroll, and spread a thin layer of filling.
Gently roll back up. Don't use too much pressure! Wrap tight in plastic wrap, refrigerate 2hr-overnight. Keeps in fridge tightly wrapped up to 3 days.

name: hong kong mango pancake
directions: Makes 4 very large thin crepes. Try a smaller pan?
Whisk eggs. Add milk, butter, vanilla, salt, whisk. Add few drops of food coloring.
Sift in flour, cornstarch, powdered sugar. Whisk til no lumps. Use sifter to strain batter (important!)
Let batter chill in fridge 2hrs.
Lightly grease large nonstick pan. Heat to med low (4/10). Gently ladle batter into pan, swirl. Cook just one side (5min?).
Let pancakes cool.
Whip cream to stiff peaks.
To fill, place pancake clean side down, spoon cream and mango in middle, then wrap like a burrito.
Chill for at least 30 min before serving, if desired.

name: rice paper mango pancake
directions: Whip cream to stiff peaks.
To fill, spoon cream and mango in middle of wet rice paper, then wrap like a burrito.

name: meringue

items.name: sugar
items.note: ideally ground or superfine, esp for pavlova

items.name: white vinegar
items.note: if making pavlova; ACV ok too

directions: Preheat oven ahead of time, because meringue must go in immediately.
Cold eggs are easier to separate. Room temp egg whites are easier to whip.
Whip egg white til soft peaks.
Add sugar 1 tbsp at a time.
Beat til stiff peaks.
Gently fold in flavorings if desired. If making pavlova, fold in vanilla/vinegar/cornstarch mix now.
Shape appropriately
Bake 225F 1hr (or 215F for 60-90min?).
Turn off oven and let meringue sit for 1-2 hrs.
Store cookies in covered container room temp for a few days, don't put in fridge.
Coffee meringue: Whip egg white + coffee til soft peaks. Gradually add sugar, beat til sugar dissolved. Pipe 2-3cm diameter pieces. Bake 1hr at 212F/100C

name: langues de chat
directions: Beat sugar + butter til fluffy. Beat in egg til batter is light and fluffy.
Stir in flavoring. Add flour and mix til blended into stiff dough.
Place batter on lined tray. Will spread a lot (2cm diameter becomes 4-5cm)
Bake for 15min or til edges golden at 320F/160C. Cool and let crisp. (If not crisp, place back in hot oven 5-10min)

name: eclairs

items.name: egg
items.note: 2oz weight with shell; ideally 1 large egg

directions: Makes 4-5 eclairs
Beat eggs together into measuring glass for easy pour.
Med heat, cold water + salt + butter. Stir occasionally.
When water start to boil (butter should be melted!), remove from stove (keep stove on) and add flour all at once.
Stir vigorously until flour is all incorporated. Wooden spoon recommended.
Place back on med heat, cook dough for 1-3 min until panade is 175F. (There should be a thin film on the bottom of saucepan once ready.)
Let dough cool to 145F. Add vanilla now if using.
Add eggs "one at a time" and whisk well after each. Stop when consistency is right (you might not use all the eggs). Should be glossy and smooth and pass the finger and spatula v test.
Mist baking sheet with water. Pipe or spoon.
15min at 450F and then 325F for 20min. Or 10min at 425F and then 325F for 30 min. Or 375F for 30-40min. Should be golden brown. Make sure to prick once out of oven. Cool.
Cut butter into pieces.
Bring milk and vanilla just to a boil. Stir to prevent film.
Whisk sugar, cornstarch, salt. Add yolk and whisk til smooth, pale, and creamy.
Gradually, to prevent curdle, add hot milk into egg mix and whisk constantly till all incorporated.
Bring mix back to stove and bring to bowl while whisking constantly. Mix till thick and puddinglike.
Whisk in vanilla if using. Quickly add in butter cubes and whisk into custard til fully incorporated. Cover with plastic and chill for 30+min.
Unfilled choux can be stored 1-2 days room temp with airtight paper towel container (crisp up in 300F oven for 5 min). Or 6 weeks in freezer (defrost 1hr at room temp, oven crisp if you want).
Custard can be stored up to 3 days in fridge.

name: cream puffs
directions: Makes 10-12 cream puffs
Beat eggs together into measuring glass for easy pour.
Med heat, cold water + sugar + salt + butter. Stir occasionally.
When water start to boil (butter should be melted!), remove from stove (keep stove on) and add flour all at once.
Stir vigorously until flour is all incorporated. Wooden spoon recommended.
Place back on med heat, cook dough for 1-3 min until panade is 175F. (There should be a thin film on the bottom of saucepan once ready.)
Let dough cool to 145F. Add vanilla now if using.
Add eggs "one at a time" and whisk well after each. Stop when consistency is right (you might not use all the eggs). Should be glossy and smooth and pass the finger and spatula v test.
Mist baking sheet with water. Pipe or spoon, 1.5-2" width 1-1.5" height, 1.5-2" space between.
Bake at 375F for 30-40min center rack (do NOT open oven til 25+min). Should be golden brown.
During last 5-10 min of baking, prick each shell and return to oven to dry out. Remove from oven, and prick again. Let cool slightly, then transfer to rack to cool completely.

Unfilled choux can be stored 1-2 days room temp with airtight paper towel container (crisp up in 300F oven for 5 min). Or 6 weeks in freezer (defrost 1hr at room temp, oven crisp if you want). Can also freeze unfilled shells and reheat.
Can also fridge unbaked dough if tightly sealed for a day.
Filled puffs can also be frozen and defrosted pretty quickly at room temp.

name: red bean paste
directions: Rinsed beans + sugar into pot with water 1 inch above.
Bring to boil, reduce, and simmer for 1 hr.
After this point, water should just cover beans.
Makes about 20 tbsp (360-380g) (1 tbsp = 18g-21g)

name: queijadas
directions: Makes 6.
Mix all smoothly.
Bake at 325F 45min. or 400F 30min.

name: tofu pudding
directions: Blend and chill.

name: chocolate cake
directions: Grease and flour 9x5 (or 8x4?) pan.
Stir sugar, flour, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, salt in large bowl.
Add eggs, buttermilk, coffee, oil, vanilla; beat on med speed with mixer 2 min. Pour batter evenly into prepared pan.
Bake at 350F 30-40 min or til tester comes out clean. Cool 10 min, remove from pan, then cool completely.
If muffins, makes 12: 350F 18-20 min or til tester clean, then cool in pan for 20 min, remove and cool completely.
Tightly wrap each layer and freeze overnight or up to 3 months. When ready to assemble, unwrap and thaw slightly, then frost.
Frosting for 1 2-3 layer cake.
Med heat. Whisk flour, milk, sugar in saucepan. Heat to a simmer, stir frequently til very thick and puddinglike.
Remove from heat. Whisk in vanilla and salt. Cool completely in wrapped bowl (touching surface to prevent skin)
Cream butter til light and fluffy. Add roux little bit at a time and beat til light and fluffy like whipped cream

name: gateau chocolate
directions: 1 6-inch cake:
Preheat oven to 338F/170C.
Melt butter, chocolate, heavy cream gently.
Mix yolk, salt, and yolk sugar. Mix in chocolate well. Sift in flour and cocoa powder. Make sure dough stays warm (104F/40C+)
Very quickly make meringue with egg white and sugar on high speed, adding sugar in 2-3 batches. Med peaks.
Gently fold meringue into batter in 2 batches.
Pour into lined 6-inch pan from 8 inch/20cm above. Drop on counter to get rid of bubbles.
Change temp and bake at 329F/165C for 28-30 min. Drop again to shock. Cool to room temp for 30+min, then chill wrapped in fridge for 5+hrs, still in cake pan.
Ganache:
Pour warmed heavy cream onto chocolate. Careful not to overheat, especially if microwaving. (Do 10 sec bursts if microwaving)
Add in butter and mix. Pour onto top of cake. Refrigerate cake for 1hr to harden. Once hardened, remove cake from pan.
Cream:
Whip very cold cream into soft peaks. Top the cake, chill for 1hr before serving.
Store in fridge for 3 days. Let come to room temp for 10 min before eating if from fridge.

name: earl grey gateau

items.name: heavy cream
items.note: mixed with 3g earl grey loose leaf

items.name: heavy cream
items.note: mixed with 2g earl grey loose leaf

directions: 1 6-inch cake:
Microwave heavy cream + earl grey for 40 sec.
Microwave butter for 1 min and melt. Add white choc and melt for another 40 sec in microwave. Melt for 10 more sec if choc still not melted.
Add condensed milk (very important!) and salt. Keep batter between 113-131F (45-55C).
Add infused heavy cream to butter mix, making sure still warm.
Add yolk and mix well. Sift in flour and mix.
Very quickly make meringue with egg white and sugar on high speed, adding sugar in 3 batches. Stiff peaks.
Fold meringue into batter in 2 batches.
Pour into lined 6-inch pan. Drop on counter to get rid of bubbles.
Bake at 329F/165C for 40 min. Drop again to shock. Cool to room temp for 30+min, then chill wrapped in fridge for 5+hrs.
Cream:
Microwave small amount of heavy cream and 2g earl grey for 30 sec. Mix in the rest of heavy cream and condensed milk. Store in fridge to chill ahead of time.
Once very cold, whip into stiff peaks. Top the cake, chill for 1hr before serving.
Store in fridge for 3 days. Let come to room temp for 10 min before eating if from fridge.

name: taiwanese castella
directions: Sift cake flour.
In small pot, heat up milk + oil on med low heat until just the center starts to bubble.
Sift in cake flour and mix well.
Whisk in salt, vanilla, and yolks til smooth.
Whip egg whites til foamy. Add sugar in 3 batches, mixing at low speed to dissolve the sugar. Beat til soft and droopy peaks.
Stir yolk batter a little. Use spatula to fold through and loosen the meringue a little. Add two scoops of meringue to yolk and balloon whisk til well combined.
Add yolk mix into rest of meringue and carefully fold with balloon whisk, finishing off with spatula.
Pour batter into lined pan from 20cm height. Bang gently to remove bubbles.
Place pan in hot water bath. Bake at 300F/150C for 45-50 min or til browned on top.
Peel paper immediately. Let cool 15 min, slice, then let cool completely.
https://youtu.be/fqKvcVscGZw

name: corn castella
directions: 16x8x6.5cm (6.3x3.15x2.55 in) loaf pan
(Can also try 60g cake flour : 40g corn flour!)
Whip egg, sugar, salt til very fluffy and pale. Should reach ribbon stage.
Sift in flours and baking powder.
Fold in gently until no dry spots.
Fold in oil and vanilla extract.
Fold in milk.
Pour into lined loaf pan, smoothing the top.
Bake at 293F/145C for 35-45 min. Remove from pan and peel paper.

name: corn castella 2
directions: Half loaf pan?
Beat yolk. Then add sugar, salt, honey. Beat til pale and fluffy.
Beat egg whites til foamy. Add sugar in 3 batches, make merginue til medium peaks.
Mix half of whites with yolk. Fold gently til combined.
Sift cake flour + baking powder into batter. Gently fold and mix.
Add warm water and combine.
Sift in corn flour + cake flour. Mix in. Batter will start to get stiff!
Add in rest of meringue and fold in.
Mix some of batter in melted butter, then pour all back into batter. Fold in til combined.
Pour into lined loaf pan, smooth the top, bang pan to remove bubbles.
Bake at 200F for 20 min with lid on, then then 170F for 1 hr without lid.

name: cream mini castella
directions: Preheat to 340F/170C.
In large bowl, beat eggs, then mix with sugar, honey, vanilla over hot water bath until 105F/40C.
In medium bowl, gently melt butter, oil, and milk over the hot water bath.
Whip egg mix on high speed until pale and fluffy. Finish off on low speed to get rid of big bubbles.
Should be at ribbon stage (ribbons last for 2-3 seconds).
Sift in cake flour, baking powder, salt.
Gently fold til just combined.
Once butter melted (120F/50C), add in a bit of the batter to the butter and mix well.
Pour back into batter and fold evenly til just mixed. Pour into 6 lined muffin tins about 3/4 up to the top, and run skewer through and tap to remove bubbles.
Bake at 320F/160C for 20 min. Remove immediately from pan.
Once cool, core the centers or cut out with a knife.
Cream:
Whip all cream ingredients til stiff peaks. Pipe into cored muffins.
Lasts 3 days tightly wrapped in fridge.

name: coffee bean cookies
directions: Whisk cake flour + cocoa powder + cornstarch. Add hot water to instant coffee.
Mix soft butter, powdered sugar, egg yolk. Pour in instant coffee into egg mix. Sift in dry ingredients and mix well.
Make 8g balls. Shape. Chill for 50 min or freeze for 25min.
330F 14 min

name: pao de queijo
directions: Bring milk, water, oil, salt to boil on med heat.
In bowl, place tapioca flour and pour hot liquid over. Mix well. Add egg, mix well.
Incorporate 1 cup of cheese. Form golf-ball size balls (~12 total balls)
Bake at 400F 15-20min, or 25-30 min if frozen.

name: korean mochi bread
directions: Toast black sesame seeds on dry pan med heat til lightly popping and fragrant.
Saucepan, milk butter sugar salt. Bring to simmer over med heat, stir occasionally.
Once simmering, take off heat, dump in flour and whisk til thick and smooth. Should be paste-y.
Add tapioca flour, mix well. Dough will be stiff and thick. Let dough cool till warm to touch.
Add beaten egg to cooled dough in 3 steps. After each addition, whisk in egg well. (Do this choux style!)
Fold in sesame seeds. Pipe into 1 inch balls, spaced 1 inch apart (about 8 total). Smooth out dough with wet fingers.
Bake at 350F for 25-30 min

name: korean mochi bread 2
directions: Makes 6 bread rolls.
Toast black sesame seeds on dry pan med heat til lightly popping and fragrant.
In pot, bring milk, oil, soy sauce, and salt to boil.
Once boiling, add flours + milk powder and take off heat. Stir til forms a dough.
In stand mixer, place cooked dough + crack in egg. Beat til smooth, then add sesame seeds til combined.
Make 6 balls (~40g each) and shape to rounds. Spray with some water for crispy crust.
Bake at 355F for 20min (rotate pan halfway for even bake) or til golden.

name: brownies
directions: Hot melted butter, oil, sugar. Beat well for a min. Add egg + vanilla, beat til light for a min.
Sift in fllour, cocoa, salt. GENLTY fold dry into well til JUST combined.
Pour into 1/3 a loaf pan
Bake 20-25min 350F. Cool to room temp and serve.

name: bean brownies
directions: Process oats briefly til like a coarse flour.
Add all ingredients except chocolate chips. Process til very smooth and thick. Add 1/2 cup of chocolate chips to batter, pulse briefly to mix in.
Pour batter into lined 8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle and lightly press in remaining chocolate chips on top.
Bake at 350F til top crackles and center feels relatively firm to a light touch (~25-30min). Allow to cool completely before cutting (2hrs).
Lasts in airtight container in fridge 1 week.

name: pound cake
directions: Pan size: 15.5x7.5x6.5cm
If making tea-flavored cake, add 4g ground tea into dry mix and 3g ground tea into glaze.
Beat butter for 1 min til fluffy. Add sugar in 3 batches, beating well for about 1 min each time.
Whisk egg. Add the egg into batter in about 10 batches, mixing well each time.
Add in the dry mix and combine. Add heavy cream and fold into batter til smooth.
Pour batter into lined pan, concave the center (so that batter smoothly goes up the shorter edges, making the batter a long U-shape).
Bake at 320F/160C for 50 min or til center is dry to the touch.
Let cool completely on rack. Wrap in plastic and let sit for a day at room temp to get moist.
Keeps for 5 days sealed.

name: dense yogurt pound cake
directions: Whisk cake flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt in large bowl.
Whisk yogurt, zest, juice in med bowl.
Beat butter and sugar on high speed til smooth and creamy, 2-3min. Med speed beat in vanilla. Low speed beat in eggs until just incorporated.
Pour dry into butter egg mix. Pour yogurt mix on top. Mix on med speed til just combined, careful not to overmix. Fold in a cup of berries if desired.
Bake in lined 9x5 loaf pan 45min 350F, use toothpick test for doneness. Foil tent halfway. Cool completely.
Store in fridge up to 5 days.

name: basque cheesecake
directions: Line 6-inch cake pan with 2 layers of parchment paper.
Smash cream cheese. Beat sugar and cream cheese til smooth and not gritty. Mix in flour.
Add in yolk and whisk til mixed. Add in whole egg and whisk til mixed.
Add in cream and whisk in. (Alternatively, try to whisk flour and cream together instead of putting flour in earlier...)
Preheat oven to 428F/220C for at least 30 min. Bake at 428F/220C for 28-30min til top is dark and almost charred but center wobbles.
Cool 3-4 hrs room temp, then remove from tin.

name: chapssaltteok
directions: Mix all dough ingredients together into a paste. Cook in microwave in batches, mixing after each--2 min, 1:30, 1 min, then 1 more min.
Dust surface with cornstarch. Makes 6 balls.
Total filling: 144g red bean (roughly 6 heaping tbsp)

name: fried chapssaltteok
directions: Mix all dough ingredients. Will be a melty dough ball. Makes 3 balls.
Option 1: Make 3 balls, fill with a total of 126g red bean (2 tbsp).
Option 2: Make 10 balls of ~18g each. Place peanut butter globs in center of 5 of them. Use the other 5 to close.
Fry on med heat (5/10) using 1/2 tsp of oil for each side.

name: grilled rice cakes
directions: In small pot, water + milk (any milk fine) + sugar + salt + oil. Bring to simmer.
Quickly pour liquids into rice flour. Stir mix quickly til fully combined. Don't worry if shaggy at first.
Once ball of dough, knead dough with greased hands ~10min til smooth. (Add tiny bit of water if too dry)
Divide into 4 portions, roll into balls and flatten with hands.
Non-stick pan med-low heat, tiny bit of oil. Cook discs til golden brown (4-5min each side).
Cool a few min then enjoy.

name: rice pudding
directions: Pot med-med high heat, melt butter and coat rice in butter.
Pour in milk and stir frequently til creamy and absorbed.
Stir in sugar and flavorings. Remove from heat.

name: mango coconut rice pudding
directions: Pot med-med high heat, cook rice, milk, salt til creamy and absorbed.
Stir in sugar and flavorings. Remove from heat.

name: panettone

items.name: lemon zest
items.note: to sub 13g of candied orange peel

ingredients.category: need 100g of candied orange peel for filling

directions: Makes 1 big loaf? Or 2 small loaves in a 6-inch cake pan (with 6cm height)
Dough 1:
Mix biga into a ball and let rise for 1hr.
Break up biga. Add sugar and cold milk. Use flat leaf paddle and mix well, 2-3min.
Add flour in one spoon at a time with mixer on low.
When all flour added, increase speed of mixer and mix til dough comes off sides and stays on paddle (7-8min). Be patient.
Switch to dough hook. On lower speed, add yolks in about 3-4 steps, waiting til fully incorporated after each.
Add honey, let mix completely. Mix til windowpane.
Add room temp melted butter, drizzling onto side of bowl, in 3 batches, waiting til completely incorporated at each step.
Let rest til tripled in size (~3h).
Dough 2:
Blend aromatic mix in blender.
Add cold milk to rested dough, mix with dough hook. Add sugar and flour and salt and knead til all combined.
Increase speed and knead til detaches from sides. Add yolks in 3-4 batches, waiting til fully incorporated after each.
Knead til windwpane. Drizzle in a bit of butter and the aromatic paste, and a bit more melted butter on top of that. Knead til well incorporated.
Drizzle in the remaining butter in 3 batches as we did with the 1st dough previously.
Cover and let duogh rest 15 min. Add candied fruit while mixing at low speed.
Shape and fold roughly into ball. Rest 15 min uncovered.
Using buttered hands, lift and fold dough into itself. Rest 15 min uncovered.
Repeat previous folding step. Should ball up better. Split dough if making multiple loaves. Tuck into a ball, rest 10 min.
Place rested dough in pan/mold. Let rise til almost to top of mold.
Score top. Bake at 338F/170C til internal temp of 201F/94C (unknown baking time! must be EXACTLY 94C. small loaf baking time ~40min?)
Cool hanging upside down. Lasts 1 week, best flavor after 48hr?
References:
https://youtu.be/fWlVq6GoKPY > source of this recipe
http://www.wildyeastblog.com/panettone-recipe > uses actual starter. very good tips about gluten development

name: chia chips
directions: Mix all. Sit room temp 1hr-overnight.
Spoon 1 tbsp amounts onto lined sheet. Smooth into small rounds.
Bake at 300F 2-3hrs or til dried. Can flip halfway thru.

name: soba boro
directions: Whisk egg + sugar til lightly foamy. Add flours + baking soda. Mix.
Drizzle in butter and knead lightly til dough is cohesive and tacky.
Wrap dough, chill for 2+hrs.
Roll dough thin (1-2mm). Bake at 350F for 10min.

name: cheesy pineapple tarts
directions: Prepare 9g balls of pineapple jam, 12 balls total. Chill in fridge.
Lightly beat soft butter. Sift in powdered sugar, add salt, and beat again til creamy, light, and smooth.
Add yolk, beat til combined. Sift in flour, cornstarch, milk powder, and add in parmesan. Mix til all combined.
If making decoration, set aside 15g to color pink and 10g to color black.
Wrap dough tight in plastic wrap to prevent drying. Rest dough in fridge for 30min.
Roll main dough into 14g balls. Flatten lightly, place jam ball in center, and close up and roll gently.
Chill shaped balls in fridge 20 min.
Bake at 290-300F/140-150C for 25-30 min.

name: corn custard snow skin mooncakes
directions: Blend milk + corn. Mix in rest of ingredients, except butter. Strain mix into nonstick pan.
Add butter into mix. Cook over low, keep stirring. Cook til custard keeps its shape and doesn't stick to pan.
Wrap and chill custard. Form 4 balls of custard, ~28g?. Keep in fridge.
Mix all dough ingredients. Strain. Steam med low heat for 25 min, covering the bowl with a plate to prevent drippage.
Can toast 1-1.5 tbsp glutinous rice flour for dusting use, low heat 5 min.
Remove steamed dough, cut into pieces, mash and knead all together while hot. Knead til smooth and elastic, with spatula at first, then with hands.

name: corn custard mooncakes
directions: Blend milk + corn. Mix in rest of ingredients, except butter. Strain mix into nonstick pan.
Add butter into mix. Cook over low, keep stirring. Cook til custard keeps its shape and doesn't stick to pan.
Wrap and chill custard. Form 8 balls of custard, ~17g?. Keep in fridge.
Lightly beat soft butter. Sift in powdered sugar, add salt, and beat again til creamy, light, and smooth.
Add yolk, beat til combined. Sift in flour, cornstarch, milk powder. Fold til just combined, do not overmix.
If making decoration, set aside 10g to color pink and 10g to color black.
Wrap dough tight in plastic wrap to prevent drying. Rest dough in fridge for 30min.
Roll main dough into 30g balls, 8 total. Flatten lightly, place custard ball in center, and close up and roll gently.
Chill shaped balls in fridge 1hr.
Bake at 320F/160C for 25-30 min. Cool to room temp.

name: saffron sesame shortbread
directions: Makes 24 biscuits.
Can also try subbing flour with 1c flour + 0.5c cornmeal.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt in medium bowl.
Beat butter, sugar, ground saffron, and egg in large bowl on med speed til light paste forms.
Gradually beat in dry mix til well combined. Knead dough til smooth. Shape into log, wrap, and chill til firm.
Divide into 24 balls. Roll each ball in sesame seed to coat.
Bake at 350F for 20 min or til lightly browned around edges. Cool completely.

name: malva pudding
directions: Cakes:

Beat butter and sugar til creamy. Add eggs, beat til light and fluffy. Add 1/2 tbsp of apricot jam (guava or strawberry or orange ok) and mix. To prevent jam lumping, warm with 1/4 tsp water til liquid.
Dissolve baking soda in milk.
In separate bowl, whisk flour and salt. Add dry ingredients to wet. Also add milk to wet.
Stir in vinegar. Combine everything.
Pour into greased 6-cup muffin pan. Bake at 350F for 30-45 min til edges golden brown.
Cream:
In saucepan, heat all ingredients over med heat til butter melted. If sauce separates while simmering, scoop out any milk solids.
When cakes come out of oven, poke holes with toothpick all over. Pour cream over hot cakes.
Let cakes sit 20-30 min to let sauce soak in. Serve warm or cold. Keep in fridge for 3 days in container.

name: greek yogurt cake
directions: Grease and line 6-inch cake pan with a single sheet of parchment (bottom and sides). Creases expected.
Whisk yogurt and eggs til all combined. Mix in sugar and cornstarch til batter smooth.
Pour into pan. Bake at 350F 70-75min or til puffed up. Cool at room temp 20 min, fridge for at least 2 hrs.
Bring to room temp for 15-30 min.

name: greek yogurt pie
directions: Mix crust ingredients and press into 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 350F for 12-14 min or til golden. Let cool.
Whip cream til soft peaks. Add in rest of ingredients, whip til all combined.
Spread filling into pie crust. Cover and freeze at least 4 hr and up to 3 days.
To serve, let stand room temp 20 min.
